text:
After years of frequenting Chatime, Happy Lemon, and Green Grotto for my bubble tea fix in the Vaughan Mills area, I am very excited about this fairly recent addition to the local bubble tea scene!

I found this Yelp page by chance while searching for a tea/coffee shop where I could get some work done. Honestly, I'm disappointed it took me so long.

At the employee's recommendation, I opted for the milk tea trio, with roasted oolong tea base. Be warned, with 3 toppings, it's more dessert than beverage! I'm not normally a taro lover, but I enjoyed the fresh taro paste a lot more than I expected to. The tapioca pearls were soft and chewy, and the pudding was smooth and decadent. Despite the roasted tea flavour being less pronounced than I normally like, it was pretty much love at first sip.

I was the only customer at half past 3 on a weekday, so the cafe was very quiet. The background music was tinkly at first, then became more upbeat into the early evening hours as more customers came in.  Because my work laptop has a low battery life, I really appreciated the availability of power outlets! The only thing I would say about working here is that the small tables are a bit low in height, which means you'll likely need to bend over to see your screen. The cafe is spacious, with plenty of natural lighting, and 2 gender neutral washrooms.

Before leaving, I ordered another milk tea trio for my partner, but sadly they were out of pudding at the time. I was encouraged to choose taro balls instead -- not my fave, but I think it's cool that they offer this. I originally tried taro paste and taro balls at Meet Fresh in the US, and had not seen these toppings offered in Canada so far.

Overall, I know it's premature to consider this a new go-to since I've only tried one drink, but I'm really impressed with this cafe. I'll continue to support this local business in giving the big chains a run for their money.

P.S. The Vicinity reward program is offered here!

The most known mall in Toronto which attracts some of the biggest traffic in all of Canada. Eaton Centre is located right at the heart of Downtown Toronto where Dundas Square and Nathan Phillips Square is.

I would recommend taking public transport to the Eaton Centre because you have to pay for parking and to get to the mall from the parking is a hassle for me.

Eaton Centre has their shops arranged where the bottom floor generally has the more affordable products, and keeps going up the hierarchy until you reach the top brands located at the top and the food court located at the very bottom. 

Eaton Centre has the most intense lineups when something hype comes out, but it's probably also one of the first places that will have that item if you're into being the first to buy things that just come out.

The design of the mall is a rectangle with a few bizzare odds and ends sticking in and out of it, so it might be a little challenging if you want to go around the escalators, but if you're a commuter and go to the PATH, you're probably a pro at it by now.

My review may be a little emotional however the staff at this establishment have bowled me over. I've spent 4 of the last 10 days here with my mom as she has gone through a batteryof test. From admissions to Radiology on the 2nd floor we have been treated with the utmost respect and care. As a care partner not only did they check on my mom and her comfort level they checked to make sure I was okay. 
After being there for hours on end everyone still had smiling faces and caring words of encouragement . All I can say is Thanks

One word can describe this Wendy's...... Horrible!!
I tried to order a large chili and 4 chicken nuggets in the drive-thru. I was told there is a 45 minute wait on chili so I changed my order to 2 four piece nuggets and it took 13 minutes to get my nuggets. HORRIBLE!!

I was in the area and saw this place, figured let's try it for lunch. And they have a drive thru. This is the main reason of why I came by. 

I waited for over 5 minutes in the drive thru without being acknowledged. At this point I thought well I'm here, park and go in. 

Restaurant is decent size. Plenty of tables and chairs to sit at. Menu is up above the front counter. I ordered the burrito with carne asada, flautas, and a side of rice and beans - all to go

The food was packaged nicely for a to- go bag,  I was given many different sauce options. However no utensils or napkins. 

The Burrito was good,  the flautas were very good,  I enjoyed the cucumber and shredded carrot on them with cheese. 

Location is Lake Mead/ Torrey Pines - ample parking

One of the best bar to hang out ! I go there at any time, 5pm, 8 pm, 10pm... They always have space to hang on in groups or in duo which is great. The atmosphere is fun, the music is good (kpop but quite different from other places since it is more hip hop in my opinion). The staff is always nice and helpful, they have a lot of variety as far as drinks go and the food is delicious; they can please to anyone going from eel to nachos.  I definitely go there often and would recommend it to anyone.

After trying the famous Fuunji in Tokyo, I've been super obsessed with tsukemen! For those unfamiliar, it's a dipping noodle with concentrated broth. I've yet to find any ramen place that has good Tsukemen.. until I tried sojo!

I got the Black Garlic Tsukemen. The presentation was super nice and the portion was huge! The broth itself was really good too. We also ordered karaage and sausage as appetizers. Our server was kind enough to bring out complimentary calamari to try as well. I don't usually like calamari but it was especially good, we ended up eating it all. It was extra buttery and not greasy! All the apps were less than a few dollars each. Also, they serve a really good salad to begin your meal.

0 wait time when we went but I expect this place to fill up soon. They have yelp check in for the waiting list which is a major perk.

I wish I got our servers name because he was so attentive and kind! He was younger with tattoos. Thanks for the awesome service! Hope to be back soon to try the spicy miso Tsukemen!

The cookies are good, but the price is a little too high. The lines are always long which is fine because I love the late hours they're open. People don't seem to have an issue with the price though as the line never stops! But overall I'll keep eating them!

Good quality Cambodian food.
Ate here several times. My friends liked it more then me as they are meat eaters. 
Rather limited menu for vegans.  And if I remember correctly was a little pricey and portions were on the small side. Still good quality food  and nice cozy atmosphere. It was more of a win for my friends. That's why the 3 stars.

I love a good cupcake and I wanted to love these but they were just ok. I chose the strawberries and cream.  I liked that the frosting was not overly sweet. The cake was pretty moist but lacking in the strawberry flavor department. I just was not wowed! The shop was cute, the girl behind the counter was really nice, and they do have a ton of flavors to choose from.

This place is excellent they have great service and my food was cooked to perfection I ordered the Reuben sandwich and it was fantastic my wife ordered a gargantuan chicken salad and it was excellent she stated my cousin ordered the lobster omlet and have no complaints well worth the time and money. Price was not that expensive only costed about $25 for me and my wife

My God dealing with this call centre is a living, hellish nightmare.

They will not escalate the call until you become a raving lunatic on the phone and demand service.  Its like their customers are working for them, i.e. they seem to "forget" that customers expect service.  Write to their Head Office in Germany and tell them about DHL's crap call centre in Brampton, Ontario.  This place raises my blood pressure and temperature every, single time.  Why do I use them?  Because I order online from Marks and Spencer in the UK in other words ... I am stuck with DHL.  They suck!!!!!!!

I had to go in for an operation on my sinuses.  I was very nervous.  The pre-op. was handled in an informative, professional and courteous manner.  My hospital experience was positive.  My Surgeon is wonderful.  The nursing staff and hospital staff are very hard working and they made my visit as comfortable as possible.  Overall, I was treated with dignity and respect by everyone throughout the entire process.  Thank you North York General for looking after me!

I've been waiting for so long for this gym to open. It's 8 mins away from my house and I've been driving all the way to Eastern to gym it. 

It has been long over due BUT totally worth it. All the new and updated equipment is the best part! The layout is great, reminds me of the Decatur gym but a bit bigger. The women's room has a squat rack, yes! 

If you don't put the address on maps you'll probably get lost so don't try to wing it and just get directions.

I was surprised to be disappointed considering the reviews. I chalk it to my higher expectations and more sophisticated palate. 

The pho was utterly disappointing. First, the broth wasn't piping hot. The beef portion was skimpy and it wasn't rare as indicated on the menu. The broth wasn't pungent as it should be. However, the noodles itself was very good - al dente!

The grilled meat wasn't marinated as well as it could have. The chicken was bland. The beef was burnt and overly dry. The pork was just very average. However, if you prefer an overly sweet sauce to your pork, then it's down your alley. Didn't quite work out for me.

Cutest little macaron shop. Super simple...menu on the walls for generous butter cream filled macarons and ice cream macarons. The ice cream macarons are huge... And need to sit for about 5mins before attempting to bite into one. But the butter cream macarons are where it's at, not overly sweet. I wanted to try every single one. Would come back again to try other flavours. The store is run by two brothers who just love to bake. It's not really a sit in type of establishment. There are 3x bar stools and a bathroom on site.

Please note that if you arrive on a weekend for breakfast you will most likely have to wait for a table (in our case is was about 15min). 
Service is quick and food comes out within a reasonable time. 
Please be prepared to fill your belly to the top due to their huge portion sizes.

Centre Island is a tourist trap. This is where families go for fun in the sun n the summer you can bbq on one of the free ones open to the public in the parks, rent bikes for an arm and a leg, hang in the kiddie funland area, go swimming, lie on the beach, take in the extensive gardens or get lost in the mega maze (think: The Shinning). If you like kids, or have kids, this is a good spot for you in the summer. Beware that they only sell junk food and there is only one bar. It's basically Wasaga Beach but only minutes from the city. Also worth noting, they don't allow bikes on the Centre Island Ferry. In case it's your first time, ferries run every 15 minutes on the weekend, cost $6 for adults and are free to get back. It's Toronto's best kept secret, and definitely worth checking out if you're a tourist.

My boyfriend and I were hungry for lunch on a Thursday. We decided to stop by On The Border Mexican Grill & Cantina at 11:00 A.M, right as the restaurant opened.

On The Border Mexican Grill & Cantina is located at the 95/Ann exit (North or South bound). It shares the same parking space as the In-n-Out and Raising Cane's Chicken. Parking can get a little difficult at this restaurant due to how busy In-N-Out and Raising Cane's Chicken can get. 

Since the restaurant had just opened, there was plenty of table spacing available for us inside the restaurant. Everything was clean and spotless inside. We were immediately greeted by the host and provided a booth table.

Our waiter immediately came out to our table, provided us menus, and asked if we wanted anything to drink. We had requested [2] waters and [1] diet coke. The drinks were out to our table in several minutes along with chips and salsa. By the time our waiter came back to the table, we were ready to order!

Appetizers:
Chicken Satay with BBQ

Meal [Entrees]:
Burrito (steak)
Chicken Fajitas

The appetizer came out shortly after we had ordered our meal, in about 5 minutes. The chicken Satay's were arranged beautifully on the plate, along with the BBQ sauce. I had tried a bite, unfortunately, it was a bit too spicy for my taste. If you like spicy food though, you should order the Chicken Satay's.  The fried breading was cooked perfectly and the chicken quality was very good with the bite that I had.

Shortly afterwards, our meals came to the table. WOW!!! I was left almost breathless at the portion of the entree size meal! You could easily share a entree with a friend or partner. If you order a entree solo, you'll be guaranteed enough food for a extra meal or two.

My boyfriend's burrito that he ordered was huge! It also came with a side of rice and beans, which was a lot as well. The burrito was quite scrumptious. It had Pico de Gallo, beans, steak, rice, sour cream, and onions inside. 

I had ordered the Chicken Fajitas. It came with Chicken, Bell peppers, Onions with a side of flour tortillas, sour cream, guacamole, cheese, pico de gallo, rice, and beans. There was barely any cheese or pico de gallo offered on the side. I had ended up ordering extra pico de gallo for the fajitas. The food was really good though and I enjoyed my meal thoroughly. I had enough food left-over for dinner the same day!

Great service. Our waiter came and checked on our table multiple times while we ate lunch at On The Border Mexcian Grill & Cantina. It was a little expensive though. Our meal came out to be approximately $40.00 and that was with a BOGO entree meal for the restaurant coupon that we had provided.

Amazing sandwiches.  The croissants are the best, buttery & flaky, yum! Cash only, but not much, you can easily get a meal for under $10. One of their turkey & cheese croissants is enough to fill me up. A little loud at lunch time, but still fast and good. Plentiful outdoor seating too (with misters the summer heat). Two thumbs up!

Whatever I need for a home project, these guys usually have it. It doesn't cost any more than Home Depot or Lowes, but it's a much smaller store, which makes it easy to run in , buy, and run out. I find I spend 10 minutes here, or 30 minutes in a Home Depot.
Knowledgeable staff, good selection of the basics, fair prices. Can't ask for more than that.

AND... you can run next door to Gallagher's & grab a beer with the time you save ;).

I don't want to sound Iike a broken record after all the stellar praise this place has already received, but for real, it's the best.
For the exceptional mix of fantastic staff, prime location, quality services and unbeatable prices I can't think of another place in the city. I will state for the record that given the opportunity I would opt for somewhere else with some outdoor bath action (bota bota nearby being a probable option). That being said, none of the other spas nearby have an everything-included situation like Scandinave. My preferred deal here is the early-morning massage: for $90 you get a 60 minute Swedish massage followed by unlimited access to the bath and saunas. With that you get the sandals, a locker, a big plushy robe and a towel. It's also worth noting that all of the massages I've had there have been top notch. 

This place really nails it on the details: it's a beautiful space, they really enforce the quiet rule, there's lot of friendly staff available, there's free snacks and filtered water, and most importantly (for me) it's spotless. Without a doubt it's the best bang for your buck when it comes to Montreal spas.

This is one of my favorite chill spots on the Strip. It overlooks the Bellagio, and you can people watch all day. 

You must try the Beer Pretzel. It is my favorite thing on the menu, and you will not be disappointed. 

I also love that you can do a beer flight and try out new beers.
They got karaoke here as well as uber  cheap liquor and amazing pizza.  I dont five star often

One of the best pizza places ever! The dough is homemade and the pizza is either ready for you to customize or you could pick their choices! I love all of the different type of vegetables, meats & cheeses to pick from! The pizza I make all the time consists of : Alfredo sauce with pesto, pineapples, chicken, spinach, tomato's, jalapeños & artichokes followed by a pesto drizzle at the end! It's just simple perfect and it's less than 10 minutes of your time for a perfe pizza!

I am starting from the beginning of our evening experience with this Italian restaurant. 

I parked our vehicle in the parking lot behind the bank from across the street, but was told after the fact, that there is parking at the rear of this place.  You just have to drive through this narrow driveway to access it.

We were early, despite the fact that reservations were made for our table. The waiting area is not much of a waiting area.  It is the narrow entrance/exit area and there is few seating, so it's basically standing around for a bit and trying to stay out of people's way.

The restaurant is not that big...A bit claustrophobic and the lighting is fairly dim.  When we were shown to our table, the lighting above, was blown out.  We were told that despite having the fixture repaired a number of times, with the restaurant structure being a century or so old, it had a 'mind of its own'. We basically had to read the drink and food menu either by candle-light (available during the evening at each table) or by the lighting of our cellulars.

Our waitress was extremely friendly and had a sense of humour.  Kudos to her, which is the reason I am providing the third star for my rating.  Bless her heart!  She knew the specials of the day and was very professional when serving us our drinks and our meals.

Now for the food...There was no pizza offered during our Saturday evening dining experience.  Apparently it is only offered during certain days of the week.  Just NOT Saturday.  So most of us at our table ordered pasta dishes.  

In my opinion, the dishes were slightly bland.  But you could tell that the pasta was definitely hand-made.  There's the bonus.  

Same goes with the dessert.  No true pizzaz but still somewhat satisfactory.

I guess, in my case, if your better half is your personal chef and cooks with a lot of flavoring and is a cake-decorator, nothing else beats their cooking. 

But...If anyone wants to give this place a try or is ever in the area...Why not?  It's within the heart of the busy Main Street action of Markham.  Saluti!

OMG, I was so excited to try this place.  Agree with Chowhounders that the croissants and pastries were ok, but nowhere in the same category as Rahier or PetiteThuet. 

Macarons were awful.  I've had many across the GTA and I'm sorry to say they were really the worse I've had.  The raspberry chocolate tasted like cough syrup and was under baked - very, very soggy, wet and gooey.  Green tea was brown in color (odd) and lacked flavor, salted caramel was the best one.  Pistachio, again, no flavor, early grey ... was that earl grey?  

Donut had a tiny sliver of chocolate hazelnut. Honestly, if you're in the area, give it a try but it's really not worth to go out of your way. There are a ton of better pastry shops in Toronto!!! Everything is really, really overpriced and TINY. Note:  They don't take credit cards, so have cash or debit card on hand, and have plenty of cash!  A real waste of my time and money.

Love Naf Naf! Long overdue review as I've been here albeit infrequently every time I'm in the area since they opened. Their steak however way you get it--bowl wrap and now as an entree you pick two is awesome. Their basmati rice and cous cous which serves as a base are better then a couple of high end Indian restaurants in town at a fraction of the price. The baba and hummus are mouth watering good. And the pita of course is light and fluffy goodness. Happy to hear they're opening more establishments in CLE.

It's been quite a few years since I've came to Cafe Fiesta. I used to kind of frequent this place and the buffet here on Sunday's for the most part they've been pretty good. I met some friends here for a Friday dinner, the hosts were ok, seem too interested in greetings when I addressed them to let them know I was meeting people already there. 

As for service, it was just ok too. I guess we came as our first waitress was about to take a break and she seemed more in a "rushy" sense to get our orders in and get out to make the switch. She wasn't too helpful when asking a couple of questions on the menu items, just gave us the short short answers as if she could careless. As she left her replacement was so much better at service and answering the questions we had for the menu items, I understand the previous waitress wanted to take her break but we didn't know until she said something and being in the customer service field myself a customer shouldn't feel "rushed" there are techniques training provides to mitigate things like this. Also, the first waitress didn't communicate well to the other waitress on our order so there were things missing that we had to tell the replacement waitress that we had ordered and was not delivered.

Anyhow all the food we ordered was great, which explains the 3-star rating. We started with the loaded nachos app, I had the chicken fried steak and eggs, my buddies had steak & potatoes and orange chicken with fried rice. The only complain I have for food was the nachos was a little bare, meaning not much cheese and chicken chunks were put on sparsely.

The parts of the cafe I saw seemed pretty clean and wasn't too busy. Our replacement waitress was great, it's unfortunate that our first waitress gave us a crappy first impression with a dirty taste.

I really love this kbbq place so much! It never disappoints me every single time I come. I love that they give me a lot of sliced up jalapeños when I ask for extra. Every time I come into the restaurant, the service is always amazing, the workers are always happy and smiling, plus they always ask if you're doing great or need anything. I definitely would recommend this place to people!

I have to update ! Still love this place ! Even had the manager reach out to me after my last visit ! You can tell they really value their customers ! Everyone is always so friendly and nice ! With this I have to stay I would so much rather pay $5 for a good muffin and amazing friendly people than  $2 for an alright muffin and crappy people!
Tonight I tried their oatmeal pie for the first time  umm May be back tomorrow for a few more ! It is on point with just enough crisp / softness and sweetness ! Great job !! Amazing ness in your mouth !

Been awhile since eating here... 

Awesome bartender suggested buffalo cauliflower,  thought he was crazy,  but we tried it out.. n ohhh my dayum was it awesome,  with gargonzola cheese scattered around it..  great crunch,  perfectly cooked.. 

Also tried the Shishito Peppers..  another surprise as the look spicy,  but very mild n well dressed..  definite party pleaser..  

the pizza was pretty great,  close to my top 5s, but hey,  it was fresh n pretty good,  cant go wrong with CPK.. 

Ask for Travis if you have any doubts about the menu items..  cheers

If you want authentic Thai food, come here! It's very delicious. Staff is super friendly. Inside gives you the feel of the Thai culture. Love the new open space concept inside as well! Definitely family friendly! We had the Panang, fried rice, sweet and sour chicken. Absolutely superb! Excellent service.
Love coming here to grab their pup cakes for my dogs. The icing to cupcake ratio is perfect and the flavor variety appeals to everyone. Definitely try the smash.

KNOCK OFF ALERT!  And it's a great thing.
 
Cafe Sanuki is a knock off of Japan's largest udon chain Marugame (for Hawaii yeeps, think our own knock off, Marukame).  

Also guessing it's Chinese and not Japanese (kunbu - Chinese on the menu vs KONBU - Japanese).  It doesn't matter as many everyday noodle shops in Japan are Chinese.  Making this place "authentic".  Go fig.

Machine made, glutinous and chewy, properly cooked udon.  Very basic Sanuki broth (lighter style, soy added to a simple bonito / konbu (dried fish / dried kelp) broth).  Ordered cafeteria style, pickup a few pieces of tempura and a musubi, pay and eat.  In and out in 10 minutes without making a dent in your wallet.

The kake (finished broth) and bukake (stop it, dirty minds - add your own concentrated broth) easily the best and the best value at $5.55.  Variants include adding meat (niku), egg (kamatama) and cold (zaru).  Lots of yoshoku and silly Americanized combos as well.  None sampled.  Seriously?  Seafood tomato cream udon?

Very ordinary tempura.  Excessively oily, over cooked, somewhat rubbery from having the batter over mixed.  You get what you pay for.  For between $1 - $2 all good.

Musubis also just OK.  Everyday short grain rice, typical "fillings" (spicy tuna, tuna with mayo, plum, spam), crisp laver surrounding it.  Over compacted but flavorful inari (cone sushi).  Again, sub $2, what do you expect.  

New, clean and friendly service.

Solid, quick and cheap just as it should be.

It was quite busy when we walked in and the entry way was quite crowded so we pushed against the wall and waited. They said they'd get a table ready for us but didn't say how long it would be and after a few groups went in ahead of us we were a bit confused. After a seat cleared my boyfriends sister went to go sit down on it- 10 minutes later the lady (who still hasn't told us how much longer it would be) walked up to us and asked to use the chair she was sitting on! I couldn't believe it (there were other seats in the restaurant for her to take) and 20 mins later (40 minutes of waiting for her to tell us how much longer it would be). We didn't complain since it was busy but it doesn't really explain how badly we were handled. 

When we sat down we ordered the cheese dish that gets set on fire and they came and gave it to us without us even knowing they set it on fire.... or saying OPA! At this point we were starting to get annoyed. (the cheese was good) 

The waiter came to get our order and the food came and they gave me the wrong dish... They offered to correct it but at this point everyone would be finished eating by the time they would have had time to replace it so i said it was okay. At this point we mentioned the cheese and they brought over another one (they did this complimentary). 

The bill came and we saw they still charged for the wrong order that i didn't eat... We were annoyed and i felt as if they knew that so we didn't think anything would be done so we paid and left. 

Not too sure about whether I would recommend. Terrible service but the food was good

When I first walked in I was a little bit intimidated... This place is intense! The hostess was very friendly and a few people even recognized him as he comes here a lot. This was my first time and he was taking me out for a treat. Everything in this place is so delicately placed. I loved the array of jewels on the table, it's a very nice touch. I ordered a very nice glass of cabernet and they also brought out a delicious amuse-bouche. Some kind of cute quinoa ball. It was actually really good, almost too cute to eat. The bread cart is out of this world. There were two kinds with cheese so of course I had to try those, plus my boss recommended the milk one.... That one practical melts in your mouth. I think our waiter knew it was my first time and that I barely got to eat any of the extremely fresh butter so he recommended that I try some crusty bread... And I tried to say no, but I'm so glad I accepted. It was so good. 

Then they brought out some kind of caviar served on top of something with a cauliflower puree. Next they brought out my appetizer of
truffled langoustine ravioli in a foie gras sauce with simmered green cabbage... And it was absolutely amazing. Highly recommend. I had never heard of langoustine before, but Abel said it was like a cross between lobster and  shrimp. He's right that was exactly how it tasted. It was so good. 
The staff was incredibly effective and helpful to ensure that no allergy or intolerance was missed. They take great care in paying attention to detail. My main course was the ribeye and it was obviously very good but they brought out these mashed potatoes and oh my goodness... Best mashed potato puree EVER.

Then the dessert cart... It's scary because everything is so tiny and adorable that you don't realize how much you are eating! This is definitely one of the best meals that I've ever eaten.

Only reason I give it a three star is because the food is good, especially their chicken wings, and they usually have a good draft beer list. Tonight was a disappointment. They were out of bells two hearted and they their IPAs on their beer list. We had to order 4, yes FOUR, times to get our beer order correct. I guess the person was new but to come back to the table FOUR times to get our beer order right for 6 people was ridiculous. We would have left then if we weren't somewhat excited for trivia night. I usually look forward to this pub but the lack of average service is disappointing. The bar area is better but the wait for food is ridiculous, almost like they're "forcing" you to order more drinks while you wait. Besides their tasty wings, I've decided to spend my money elsewhere.

July, 2019 - much better maybe because we got seated up front!  We noticed when seated in the back room service is slightly different and possibly slower.  Many of the items I love (shrimp and peppers, eggplant and a few others you should probably order up front because for the 1.5 hours we were there, both times I never saw them).  On that note the rice flour shrimp rolls has to be ordered as well.  But the good news they have them!

1) Shrimp rolls: very good today and fresh!
2) Shrimp crispy roll: I love the small versions.  Theses were huge and every bite had 3-5 little shrimps.  Not a hit for us but crispy!
3) Steamed Pork & shrimp dumplings: I can't have them (mushrooms) but always my sons favorite!
4) Steamed shrimp dumplings: My favorite when the shrimp is fresh and they were.  Hint: 1st timers mix some soy sauce and Sriracha together for a dip!
5) Custom order: Fried rice with chicken. No taste at all.  Pass.
6) Spicy crispy chicken: a little too hot for us but really good.
7) Special order: Green pepper with shrimp (and the black bean sauce): yummy!
8) Sesame balls (red bean paste inside, best when hot).  Note; squish in half to get two beautiful even pieces!

Two stars for the price $10 and packing the only good thing about this place. My green curry was spicy but had no flavour whatsoever. 4 tiny slices of dried out chicken carrots, cauliflower and broccoli???? Since when there's cauliflower, broccoli and carrots in green curry? No zucchini and no bell peppers as indicated on their menu. Food is nothing special. Cheap but not cheap enough for me to return.

As a UNR alum, I was nervous about coming to UNLV for grad school. However, UNLV has exceeded my expectations! The campus is newer, so the library and gym are really nice. The Graduate College and Graduate and Professional Student Association offer many CV building activities and certifications as well as funding and award opportunities. There is a university-wide top tier initiative, which directly benefits grad students with GA stipend increases and funding for research. I'm really glad I came here!

My 3 year old asked if they had marshmallows and lo and behold they had marshmallow fluff. My husband got the Randy Hahn. He said it was good, but nothing to write home about. I got the Madison Bumgarner with lettuce and tomato. It was very good, but my sandwich cost as much as my husbands sandwich, drink, and chips. Portion to prices are a little off, ( over $30 for lunch) but worth checking out again.
Bimbimbap can be w avocado! Pretty good! Quick service and fairly priced! Chirachi plate is worth it too.

I was excited to see this Costa Vida open up as the location in Avondale closed years ago and I remembered the sweet pork being really good. In its absence, Cafe Rio has become my go-to so I wanted to see how it compares. My sweet pork burrito was very similar, however I would say that Cafe Rio has a better tasting tortilla. Still very good though.
A great coffee & bagel shop. I loved the White Mocha Raspberry frozen & the egg white,avocado in everything bagel.Shelby the server is great, answer the trivia question to get a 10% off

Came here for lunch during the week and tried the AYCE. This is probably the worse AYCE I've ever had. The price was $35.99 per person all day and for that price for AYCe the food quality should be on the higher quality side. Not so at this place. Most of the dishes that came were repeats of the same item but with different sauces thrown on. The fried shrimp and shrimp tempura came as same items except fried shrimp had some sauce thrown on. Aburi sushi was terrible. Salmon tataki with mustard sauce was gross. Tempura and salmon teriyaki were the only items that resembled Japanese food. The only thing I repeatedly ordered was green salad. Restaurant staff younger and you don't feel you're in a Japanese restaurant. Over priced and poor food quality. Based on this experience will not return or try another kaka location.
Always exceptional service. Bobby J is pleasant and polite. Kudos for great customer service and great food

This is one massive Cineplex with close to 30 auditoriums for movies and one heck of a parking that fills up 360 degrees around the auditorium. 

Located in Winston Churchill area, this Cineplex is where the famous iFly location is (this is easily visible when you are driving on the 401 back to Toronto from the West end). The entrance is difficult to find, because this area of fun is made into it's own little village. However, we were able to find the entrance by following folks entering the cinema as well.

Once we entered, the Xscape was located right up front. There were quite a few people playing here, despite the Dave and Busters location being next door. 

Since it was a long weekend, the lineups were MASSIVE. Literally, it was close to being out the door, but this was also because people didn't use the round-about lines properly. If a Cineplex staff came to regulate this, it might have been better. In addition, there were stations were you can purchase tickets from a KIOSK machine. The line for this was confusing as well, it seemed that people can just go to it even if they just entered and didn't actually need to line up for this. 

The ticket entry point was VERY clear though, and blocked off quite well with two attendants at the door. Once inside the movie theatre, there was a lot more space and signs were labelled very clearly where all of the auditoriums were. Purchasing food was fairly easy as well, and it was quite clean in this theatre as well. BONUS: I think you can also order alcohol in this movie theatre as well, I saw signs for alcohol options, but I'm not sure how it works!

They have done some renovation over the years and currently there are two sides open again. Furniture is a a little divey but now there is also a fast food joint inside or available next door before you go inside. There's a bar with a bartender always available. They have $0.25 tables and per hour cost tables as well. Friday's and Saturday nights tend to be the busiest and they card IDs for 18+ around curfew. Chill vibes and you can smoke cigarettes or vape and drink some beers. Worth checking out.

This was my first time here and I must say. It was a great experience !! I love the reclining chairs in the theater ! They have a bar area where you can post up and watch the game and get an ice cold beer !! we tried the VR rollercoaster and it was a BLAST !! this place is a great family fun destination !! I will definitely be going back !!

Had to make last minute appointment to get my Rear Control Arms/Rear Shocks done that wasn't done last weekend thought I need to get it going soon from preventing any accidents. When I went there - Mike was helpful on letting me know and upfront what it looks like what I really needed done instead of people from other mechanical location telling me what is recommended. So what we did was the Rear Shocks where is preventable and also to help my budget at the same time. Thank you, Sun Auto Service caring for your customers!

I was very lucky to be introduced to Brazilian food as I had never tried it before, it was an interesting experience but be sure to come with someone who speaks Portuguese, you will get a different feeling out of it. Most of the customers base were Portuguese spoke the language hence the service was amazing!

This place gets quite busy on the weekends, we pre-ordered feijoada, which is traditionally eaten during lunch because its considered to be heavy, there was cassava and the portions were huge, i think we should have ordered one to share instead of 2 portions as we didn't end up being able to eat all of it. I love the drinks, caprihina (hope thats the correct spelling) the only downfall is that it had alot of ice in it. I think this is the way its served cuz the weather is way hotter in Brazil, a bit less ice would have made me happier.

Overall, this is a place to go for authentic food in Toronto, there aint too many Brazillian food restos i think.

This is a new place next to Hobak Korean bbq. 

They exterior is very unassuming. There is no sign only a large wooden door that looks like it leads into a castle. 

Inside you'll find a very cool interior with great and eclectic design featuring a design that feels something like a cross between a factory and a living room. Mismatched furniture, old factory carts, hanging plants, incredibly cool art. It all works! 

They have a small case of pastries as well as assorted beverages available. Tea is served with cool actual tea sets you take to your table or couch. 

The pastries themselves, however, were not amazing. The rose cake was probably the best with a pleasant and light rose flavor. We tried a couple other cakes, though, and found the sponge to be rather dry and unimpressive. The staff were ok, but it took forever for the to go order to be ready even though we just ordered a few items from the case. 

Definitely stop by to check out the impressive interior and maybe try something, but don't expect the food to be as impressive as their interior design, though.

I would apply five stars, but my selfishness has driven me in only providing four. 
It's not close by me, not even a five mile radius.  Keep going, going...:(
Luckily they are on Whole Foods and/or Skinny Fats.
Still, you guessed it not the same. 
Service is always phenomenal.
Place is also spotless. 
Espresso- exceptional. 
THE egg salad is why I really make the exerted effort in heading over here. 
Not 'runny' at all. Who prefers eggs as such, they don't run. Let's be clear:) however these eggs come with a kick!
A jalapeño kick and it is perfection. 
Yes, exerted effort. 
Locating a parking space, well it can be challenging. 
Food quality A+, ingredients are deserving of that caffeine shot. 
Shot, espresso shot!  
It is non alcoholic- BONUS;)

I order from Panda Express all over the city, and this one is the worst! Overloaded my plate with rice, covering half the proteins. and later I figured why they covered it with rice! I ordered sweetfire chicken breast and it was not included in the dish, but somehow they just added a bunch of string beans, JUST THE STRING BEANS, not the string beans with chicken breast. Honey sesame chicken had about 3 of the smallest pieces ever, honestly I think it was mainly just batter. If you've run out of a product, let the customer know and give them options for a substitution. Don't just charge them for it and cover it up with a bunch of rice and hope to get away with it. This is not right the right way to do business, SHAME ON YOU, Panda Express #1476

Dropped by Obon for a Saturday night dinner and was not disappointed! Being vegetarian, good ramen is hard to come by and oftentimes, I'm presented with a literal salt water broth with veggies and noodles. Thus, I was very pleasantly surprised by the vegetarian ramen at Obon! I grabbed the veggie white ramen which had a good flavor overall -- and of course, I added the spice bomb to it. It left me super curious about the veggie red miso ramen so I guess I'll have to go back and try that! 

My friend and I also grabbed the cauliflower karaage which was a great app and some bao buns -- jackfruit for me, bird (fried chicken) for my friend -- and they turned out to be pretty delicious as well. Only downside were the street noodles which my friend got; essentially, they were a bit sweeter than he would have preferred but it was more of a personal taste issue than a flavor call.

We both loved Obon overall and will be back to try some more of the menu items! Parking is pretty simple in the covered parking garages and you can even make an online reservation if you are worried about crowds~
I'm not a picky eater. Came here for lunch and selection was minimal. Ribs were all fatty, desert was crusty and hard, food seems old and not well put together

Highest recommendation! So fun! I learned SO much in a short amount of time!
I decided to try out bartending, but what school to go to? ABC came highly recommended, and now I know why. 
From the first moment I called, after hours, and got a return call less than ten minutes later, I knew they were all about customer service. 
I visited a night class, and met with the instructor, Larry. He told me all about their program and their business history, all the while telling amusing stories and anecdotes. I was really disappointed that I would have to take daytime classes, and miss out on Larry.
I came to apply for the school during the daytime. The instructor/owner Greg, was very gracious and, even though I was interrupting a class, he took the time to explain everything, how the program worked, what's expected, etc.
Right away, when class, started, I saw that Greg, too, was fun, funny, BUT he took the education seriously. YES: He can yell like a drill instructor, but he also cares like a father to his children. I think if you can't take yelling from a caring teacher, how are you gonna handle drunks at a bar?!
During the classes, Greg (and I presume Larry, too) tell wonderful stories that help you remember the drinks, and have a good time (Brandy (That slut!) who works as a sTinger at the SpearMINT Rhino.. Take the class, and you'll know why I'll never forget this drink recipe!). 

As a newbie to bartending, I took the two-week class: three hours a day, for ten days (Monday-Friday). This gave me time to study. I got to know other students in the class. We studied off each other. The break times (such as when others come in to sign up) were helpful, also, to absorb the information just taught. 

ABC is licensed by the state of Nevada, and their course changes and evolves to keep up with current trends and popular drinks. 

Once graduated, they don't forget about you. No sir! They have a job listing program in which many of the local bars and casinos contact ABC to hire new graduates. These places want to get people before they develop bad habits. 

Not sure what else to say but if you're looking to be a bartender, look no further. This is THE place to go to learn how!

I have been going here for years and up until wen. June 22nd was satisfied I had an abusive barber a young Hispanic male ...don't know his  name ....kept pounding the comb into .my scalp   until  I couldn't take it anymore  and informed him of my pain...he and the blond barber next to him seemed amused and exchanged some words and laughed at my expense. .when I called the manager he shrugged it off.....I will not go back.....EVER!!!!!!

Great gem. The place is absolutely stunning. The decor is incredible. You could go a few times a week and have a different view depending on where you sit. The area is actually quite large but they definitely fill up. Even though it is quite busy, you still feel like it's a quiet, personal setting. There are a bunch of books around for you to just pick up and start reading. The tea is delicious and served in cute personal tea pots and tea cups. The desserts are good. The butterfly latte was very good. My only complaint would be it wasn't really that hot. The rose lychee dessert was phenomenal. I love meringue and all of those flavors blended so beautifully. My mouth was in full enjoyment. This is a great place to hang out with friends and chat or even great for a date night.

Mood - lunch

This review is based off of my drive thru experience.

Whenever I come here, the lines always move fairly quickly. The customer service is always very friendly. I enjoy how my orders are usually separated in different bags as well. This makes things easier for when I get home, and disburse the food.

I usually opt for the chicken power bowl, or the doritos locos. Which never disappoint at this particular location. 

Would recommend- pricing is reasonable 

Location is Craig/ Lamb - ample parking
Went here today my friend & I, her hash browns were hard & burnt. Coke slaw was runny. The server was not friendly or smiled,looked bored.

Wow! That's how I'll start this review. First we were met and greeted by a very very nice young man who graciously shared all of the must knows! We were first timers and curious as to the rave reviews and decided to try it out. 
I tried the whole wheat honey bread and it immediately brought me back to my grandmothers homemade bread; with butter and just yummy! My boyfriend had the chicken berry which was delish! 

We will definitely be back!
Very yummy brunch plates. Tried the posole brought out with freshly made tortillas. Drinks delicious and restaurant is very cute. Downtown overpriced but nice atmosphere I think it was worth it.

Best gas prices around.

If you want to fill up on your way into work, you can because they open VERY early.  You can also stop on your way home from work.

Me, I go in the middle of the day.  The islands have plenty of space between them.  The pumps work.  Just remember that Costco doesn't take American Express any longer.

Groupon asked my friend and I to give this place a try, so we gave this studio a try! 

I am so glad we did!  It's located at a good location - relatively close to the freeway.  They offer a wide variety of classes.  Classes are offered every day at almost every hour.  They even have Ballroom Dancing!!!  

Instructors - they are awesome!  I have not had one bad instructor, and there are many instructors!!!  If you feel like kicking it at yoga today, they have instructors for that.  Feel like getting your butts kicked, they definitely have instructors for that as well! 

Cleanliness - the classrooms themselves are relatively cleaner than other studios in town.  They use these microbial mats/carpets which doesn't stink!  (If you've been to hot yoga with carpets, you'd know what I mean - STINKY!)  Practicing hot yoga in a stinky room = no bueno. 

VegasHot also offers purified water for everyone to fill their bottles with, which is AWESOME to replenish your body with electrolytes.  Oh, did I mention it is FREE? 

Students are offered unbelievable rates, and one of the reason why they can offer such rate is because of their "tipping" system.  This is one way for students to show their appreciations for their instructors.  

I have had plenty of offers to try other studios in town, but I honestly think I have found the studio I am willing to commit to!  And that's saying a lot.  Yay!

This was my first time at this location after many trips to their location in Las Vegas.  This time I have the veggie platter and it was outstanding.  Grape Leaves, Falafel, Salad, and the Quinao was fantastic.  I go to one of their restaurants anytime I'm in the area.  5 Star all day long!!!

Saw the news story on TV but I have seen Phil the Grill on BBQ PitMasters episode and said I had to try it out.  The wait was not long and it wasn't very crowded so we were able to get our order in and not too much longer we had our food.  It's a small place but that's not a bad thing and we will be back soon

Best dive bar in the CLE - & so underrated that I'm hesitant to even review it because I don't want other people to find it. 

it can get busy at night, but in the daylight hours & into the early evening, it's perfectly chill. Just a few beers on tap, but they're good ones, plus a full bar. Friendly, adept bartenders with great stories & lots of Cleveland knowledge. Add in the cute little patio in the back on warm nights, & this place can't be beat.

I mean... don't go there. You'll hate it. Definitely don't go.

I just can't do it anymore. I used to love Taco Bell. Hell, I practically lived off of it for a few years in the 90's! 

This Taco Bell is the one that is the closest to my house and it is just so terrible. Every time I go there, the service is apathetic at best and atrocious at its worst. Every few months, I try it again, hoping it will be alright so I can keep coming back. Every time I go it's always a big disappointment. 

Taco Bell is now on the same category as KFC in my book. I'm finlly throwing in the towel.

1 star.

No mas.

Love this place for their Biryani.. especially the Chicken fry type was really good! Not to forget the ambience was ok but the 5 stars given is for the flavour as well as the taste.

Though not so appealing interiors.. this place to a surprise is a must go if you are in and around Phoenix area. Also we ordered onion pakora which has right amount of spice and perfectly fried chilli with not much of heat inside.. I'd definitely go back if I am in Phoenix again!

Planta Queen is the newest star in the constellation of Chase Group's upscale plant-based restaurants, in partnership with Chef David Lee. After the original location in Yorkville, followed by South Beach, the newest restaurant on Queen Street has a definite Asian flair.

Coat check is available upon arrival. The bar sits at the front of the house, surrounded by tables, overlooking the streetcars gliding along Queen Street. A few steps up brings us to the main dining room, with softer lightning and plenty of seating. Japanese maples dominate the centre of the room, while bold wallpaper adorns the walls. At the back, the kitchen is visible through a large amber glass panel.

The menu comprises of offerings ranging from nigiri, maki rolls and salads, through dumplings and small plates, all the way to larger wok, noodles & rice dishes.

I was intrigued by the Japanese inspired offerings, and decided to start with  Mushroom and Unagi Eggplant nigiri, followed by Rainbow Roll. The Unagi Eggplant (lemon, pomegranate) was served in unagi sauce, and did a notable job mimicking the texture of real unagi (eel). The mushroom nigiri (truffled soya) texture was interesting and reminded me of abalone. The Rainbow Roll (ahi watermelon, avocado, crispy mushroom, gochujang) had nice flavor; the crispy mushroom strongly reminded me of deep fried fish texture.They were both nice light starters for a meal.

Our first main course - General Lee's Cauliflower (sesame, scallions) - was seared in a sweet sauce; the outer crust had a nice texture, slightly crunchy; the serving size was on the small size for a main. Our second main - Udon (truffle scented mushrooms, miso coconut milk, chives) - was absolutely our favorite dish of the evening; the coconut sauce was heavenly (not sure if there was green curry or something else in it, besides miso), and paired very well with the mushrooms and greens (I believe baby bok choi and watercress). I wish they had bread, so I could soak and have all the sauce at the bottom of the dish.

On our server's recommendation, for dessert we ordered Hawaiian Pineapple (bubble tea pearls, passion fruit gelato, lime leaf) and Halo Halo (matcha gelato, tropical fruits, purple potato, condenses coconut milk). Hawaiian Pineapple was our favorite; it was refreshing, not overly sweet, and the flavors were simple but memorable; honestly, I could not tell there was passion fruit in the gelato. Halo Halo was colorful and interesting with many different flavors, but seemed that something was missing to bring them all together.

Service is professional and efficient. Parking is available in one of the numerous parking lots in downtown, such as city hall or on the corner of St. Patrick St. and Michael Sweet Ave. Easy TTC access by subway on University Ave. or streetcar on Queen St.
Good store.  I just stopped in and they hooked me up with some quick maintenance.  No charge, I bought some other supplies but I drive past other stores to get to Bike Barn.

I came here today because my mom keep seeing posts about their soft opening on Facebook. The first impression wasn't very good. Everything was out of place. Staff was on the slower side and they seem like they didn't know their roles in the restaurant. Or, they are just understaffed. One of the staff insist on giving us a number for a table when there's one available? Anywho, we ordered the curry beef brisket with rice, french toast and iced milk tea. I have to say I'm most impressed with their milk tea. The tea that they used is legit and brought back memories of local hk resturants. The French toast was awesome too. The crust was light and crispy. There's also peanut butter inside. It might lack originally with the breading, but the taste is on point. I'm most disappointed with the curry beef brisket. I would think that I'm paying for chunks of briskets with that price, but half of it was just small pieces of briskets.

NEVER AGAIN.

Worst. Customer. Service. Ever.  Ordered a 3-piece meal with extra sides.  Food was packaged in large box that appeared to have been previously used for a large order of chicken, and I didn't receive one of my sides.  This is the worst Church's location in the area and the owner(s) just don't seem to care.  Spend your hard-earned money elsewhere.

The one star is because the sales consultant (Marlon) was  really nice/professional/straightforward when we came and drove originally when we came back is when the shenanigans began with the sales manager wasting two entire days of negotiations that turned into them letting me know they would rather sell me a new car. Be straightforward and don't waste people's time and we might have bought a new car. Instead the picture is where I ended up happily. Go to Subaru of south blvd. No games or bullshit simply selling cars.

My first Korean barbecue experience was here at Hobak. The only reason why I chose this restaurant to dine at was because Andrew Zimmerman recommended it. (I think I saw it on Travel Channel or the Food Network) Also, my girlfriend and her husband highly recommended it. Thankfully for my first experience here my friend and her husband came with us. 

Something to know is this restaurant does not take reservations and they are very busy so do not show up with a empty stomach because there is going to be a wait. We ended up waiting about 35 mins for our table. 

Once inside the atmosphere reminded me of a nightclub. There was a lot going on and it was very loud. Being that this was my first time here, I felt a little overwhelmed and wasn't really sure what was going on. Our server was very nice we let her know that it was our first time but the people that were with us had been there before. We were a party of 4 she recommended that we ordered 2 family meals and adding in a extra protein. She told us that this would be saving us money in the long run. (To be honest with you I didn't even take a look at the menu because the couple that we are with just agreed to what she had suggested). The table was crowded with lots of different items to taste (dipping sauces, salt, salads, soup, egg soufflé...etc) we had so much food. Probably could have done without the desert but it was included in the family meal. The whole experience was very cool, I did like that our server cook the meat for us. However, I would've like to do it myself because some of the meat was undercooked tremendously and some was overcooked. The other thing that I noticed was a lot of the meat had a lot of fat on it. If you're not one that likes fat on your steak this is your warning. My husband is one of those people so I ate the fatty meat and he ate most of the shaved meat. 

I would highly recommend this place if it's your birthday because they go all out singing and dancing (which was a huge surprise because I wasn't expecting that! )They have amazing Korean cocktails made of soju and the Korean beer was delicious. 

Last but not least you must check out the bathroom! Not only do you get a lesson in Korean blaring through the speaker they also offer throwaway toothbrushes, toothpaste and mouthwash. (Loved that) 

Overall four stars out of five because of the meat debacle and I felt a little bit rushed to get out of our table since people were waiting.

Nothing changed. Decided on another shot. Swing and a miss. Still totally unhelpful and dismissive. Still, apparently, adverse to having non-Asian customers. Us round eyes aren't worthy of their attention. I now go to Seafood City. Worth the extra distance. They have great stuff and care about their customers. Crazy concept this place hasn't figured out.

This place is beyond ridiculous!! This hospital has become an inside joke and NO ONE IS LAUGHING but no one cares either! This is the absolute worst care I have ever received and I can't understand why all the bad or less than 3 star reviews are basically "filtered". As of writing this there are 63 reviews that are filtered addressing the same issues that I have faced so who wouldn't want to know about this?  I know I'm not the only patient who struggles with their mistakes and incompetence. 
  PARKING:  AN ABSOLUTE JOKE!!!  The lines of traffic are LONG, you never know if the bar is going to rise up and let you in and the parking attendants (if there is one around, it's been 50/50).  I miss when they had actual parking attendants in a booth but to "save money" they got rid of them and now you deal with a ticket system and HOPE, WISH, and PRAY it all works out.  It didn't work out for me.  An attendant was standing by the gate but as soon as the bar went up, I moved forward and the BAR CAME RIGHT BACK DOWN ON THE HOOD OF MY CAR!!!!!  WHAT THE *#@!!!  All the parking attendant could say is, "Why isn't this working??"  "YOU TELL ME HONEY!"  Eventually, the bar came back up and I FLOORED it past the gate bar so it wouldnt damage my car.  After inspection though, (THANKFULLY the bar had padding underneath) it didn't even scratch my car.  This is still NO excuse!  One of the nurses even told me it's getting worse for parking!  They actually make their employees PAY FOR PARKING EVERY MONTH!  As much as $50 a month! Now they are raising it even more from what they said!  Plus, they do NOT get any discounts on food, (FULL PRICE FOR EVERYONE).  I can understand why some employees are upset and work at other hospitals.
  I was sitting in the digestive diseases area at main campus and apparently I'm just supposed to "sit and wait" for an hour of NOTHING before my procedure. What a joke! I wasn't told this beforehand, it just appeared they changed my schedule time (again) without telling me.  I guess I'm SUPPOSED to sit here even before being prepped for a procedure and wait an hour before any procedure without explanation. Meanwhile this tiny 15 chair waiting room is about to become "Standing Room Only" it has become so full in the past hour of waiting. Not only that, there is a sign saying "If you're leaving the waiting area , please stop by the front desk to pick up a pager." This means you WILL be waiting so go ahead and leave, we'll page you causing an inconvenience to other patients and making them wait longer. If this isn't enough, the secretaries have NO manners or even a care in the world beyond themselves because I kept confronting them on my appointment and they just repeated what I already knew and when I asked for the pager it's ONLY for families! This is just some of MANY issues the Cleveland Clinic suffers from but there is obviously the feeling that  there is some "covering up" of what REALLY goes on at the Main Campus because all of these problems and issues should be addressed within the Clinic.  THIS IS NOT WORLD CLASS CARE! It's World Class Carelessness! 
   The ONLY redeeming quality here are the doctors but they can't really do anything about this inconvenience because most of the doctors are not even aware of several issues.  My doctor was upset for me that I waited right around 90 minutes and NONE of her staff, nurses or aides called me back before being prepped for my procedure.  This is POOR communication, POOR service and on top of that if you know I'm upset DON'T insert an IV in one arm and check my blood pressure in the other arm AT THE SAME TIME!!! Nursing 101: PAIN MAKES BLOOD PRESSURE INCREASE ESPECIALLY IF THE PATIENT IS ALREADY UPSET!!  
   I have never been mistreated and ignored like this at any hospital before and it's upsetting.  I was NPO (nothing by mouth so no food or drink) since the night before so I had an empty stomach, checked in at the time they told me (an hour before the procedure) thinking and believing that I would be prepped for my procedure.  Nope, because of everyone there I didn't have my procedure for almost an hour AFTER I was put in a bed so we are WAY behind schedule now.  I cannot believe that the Cleveland Clinic is regarded as high as it is but performs day to day like this.  I have never been scared before a procedure but being treated like this beforehand I can honestly say that I was worried how this whole procedure was going to turn out.  Overall, I lived. Yay.  The doctor was very understanding but the main campus suffers greatly from LACK of communication and that is leading to and causing both patients and staff to leave main campus and go elsewhere.  
     If you do find a good doctor at main campus you have to ask yourself is parking and a high volume of people and lack of communication worth it?? If you can manage that then I commend you and join you because with my health situation on top of finding a wonderful doctor that is difficult enough.

Had a good experience here getting my oil changed on a 2013 Honda CRV.  Made an appointment for 07:30, showed up on time, and was out by 08:30.  Service person (Jesus) was friendly and informative.  Oil change cost $38.  Would go again, as they had free WIFI, coffee, and workstation desks available while I waited.

I have been to this location many times, just can't believe that I never checked in or wrote about them.  I have always enjoyed their food and service.  But noticed the place just was not so clean (table & chairs) a little dirty.  =(

This is a great museum! Especially if you have little ones who have too much energy, this is a perfect location to bring them. There's plenty of grass area to frolic and play. Plus, they have a scavenger hunt if the kids are feeling adventurous. There's something to find in almost every area and exhibit. 
I've been taking my daughter since she was two and is now eight and still asks to come to the museum. 

It's fun also around the holidays because the old houses are all decorated for Halloween, Christmas, etc. Summer time can be hot. No matter the season it's never super busy. I really like the little walking trail along the trees and ponds. 

It's super cheap to come visit. Only a dollar for kids and two for adults. There's so much history to see about Clark county and it's quite interesting. The October 1 exhibit is opened and is very touching.

Holy cow! I was losing faith that nail salons in Madison didn't  understood what a proper calf and foot massage entails!

This place is great! The gentleman who was doing my pedicure ask right away if I was a runner (maybe he could tell by my feet, or the fact that I came in wearing yoga pants. Either way, he worked me out! Everytime I thought it was over, he pulled out another lotion or sea salt. I was in heaven!

We went to the Wok again last night and I tell you that I cannot find a better Asian Restaurant in Vegas and we have been to a few before finding this Gem.
The staff (Zoe & Cindy) and Tony the manager go out of their way to help you get the Absolute Best Meal they can give you. We had the Appitizer Paper Wrap Chicken and it was phenomenal along with the Best Fried Rice around. I had the Boneless Spare Ribs and they were Super.
No matter what way you like your food Tony will cook it to your liking either Hot Hot or a great mild dinner. 
Stop by and treat yourself to a Great Asian meal any way that you like it.
Robbie & Linda Wells

Came in during lunch for a meeting. Nice spot to grab a drink and study since it is across from CSN. Very large space to accommodate big parties if needed. Bee sting wings were tiny and had a funny taste, they also take 20 mins to make. Flavor was a bit lacking and again I had to take tiny bites.. I like to take BIG bites :D

Spend your money elsewhere for tint, not worth the headache dealing with poor workmanship and poor customer service. Still THE WORST tint place. Please people read the posts on this place. So many negative reviews only way to stop them from doing business, don't give them your business........

Heard about Simon's from a vegan facebook group. I was blown away that that majoroty of the menu could be customized to be vegan. Vegan mac and cheese included! The space was off the main road lf Old Town. A little hidden in industrial looking buildings and offices, you wouldn't expect a restaurant. We came a bit after the lunch hour and it were probably about 4 other parties. We ordered the vegan hola amigo hot dog, vegan mac, and vegan empanadas. I opted the sausage route, but they also offer the "traditional" vegan dog. It was a good blend of flavors. The empanadas and the mac were SO delicious. Mac was creamy and perfect and for that alone, I would be back. They even offered vegan dulce de leche cookies! Which we had and loved. Will definitely be re-visiting and reccomending Simon's!

Nook has 2 locations, one in Arcadia and this one in downtown phx. I have been to both and can honestly say that I'm not a huge fan. Their pizza is decent, but nothing that I would go out of my way for. It's also pretty pricey. If I'm paying a lot of money for pizza I expect the overall quality to be on point, and unfortunately Nook isn't really there yet in my opinion. I would recommend trying them out for yourself to see what you think, but it's just okay for me.

This place is great. Service is always friendly. Facility is clean and restrooms smell great. Food is fantastic. I have tried almost everything on their menu. Stick to seafood as burritos, quesadillas, tacos etc are very average and almost Americanized Mexican food. It's almost like Roberto's(which is not that great). It is good overall, but seafood yum! I've had molcajetes, siete mares, tostadas, micheladas etc all amazing!! Four stars as location is very small, parking is limited and we always have to park behind the building. Average wait is 15-20min for a table, but wait is worth it. We will definitely be returning.

Alright, I'm finally hopping on this Brew Tea Bar train. I finally got to try out this joint after months of reading and hearing about how great it was. Was there hype surrounding BTB? Definitely. But did it live up to it? Ummm yes!

Although it is pretty far from me (Henderson), I was out on the west side of town and  decided to drop in for a refreshing snack. The shop itself is very quaint with several tables and chairs to socialize. Unfortunately, I don't think this is a great place to study (which is something I'm still looking for in a cafe)

I digress. There is a very extensive menu that I was overwhelmed at first, especially with a growing line behind me. The worker manning the front was very patient and helpful! He went through a couple of his personal and customer favorites and explained what their Hokkaido and Okinawan milk teas were. 

I opted for the Hokkaido milk tea with boba and also got to try my friend's Okinawan milk tea (brown sugar taste) One sip of the Hokkaido and I had flashbacks of Japan! It was quite enjoyable but a little too sweet for my tastes. I'll opt for a less sweet version next time. 

Overall, definitely my favorite place to grab drinks/slushes/teas now with great staff and lots of tasty options!

Seems like a great neighborhood cafe. I would love to have this cafe across the street. The WiFi tested at 15/8, there is at least one electrical power outlet so it's a good place to work. The cafe fits about 25 people including sofa seating at the front. One washroom in the back. I didn't see any high chairs. There is a self-serve infused water container at the front. The menu includes coffee, espresso, babyccino, hot chocolate, tumeric lattes and more. The pastry selection is about twice the norm. Staff is sweet and pleasant. Solid cafe option.

The owner, Chris, is very responsive when there's a problem, which is why I'm giving them two stars. Unfortunately, the problems are too often with their workers. I watch the pool techs come, spend 5-10 minutes, and only use a net/empty skimmer when they come. If we weren't paying for chemicals too, this wouldn't be a problem, but we're paying dearly for service and chemicals we're not receiving. 

During the summer with their "complete maintenance," we had a major algae problem in our newly finished pool, which should not have happened if they were correctly balancing chemicals. Even after involving the owner, the techs continue to not check the chlorine balance weekly, or provide the necessary chemicals as needed. 

Our pool is an expensive investment; too expensive to leave it in the hands of techs who cheat CMK's customers.

Update: Still not worth the single star given. I emailed as instructed and received a call. Representative was apologetic and ensured they'd be addressing it with the 3rd party carrier. Paper was then delivered for just less than a week straight and then right on schedule, 2 days with no paper. I'm sure those who are contributing to the content of this paper would just LOVE to know that it doesn't reach what I have to assume is a large portion of their subscribers. There are simply far too many folks who need a job for you to continue to use a service that refuses to deliver for something that has already been paid for. Don't waste your money, especially if on a fixed income like this situation where you just want to get what you've paid for with an ounce of consistency.
Food, Beer and SERVICE was fantastic--our server--Stephane couldn't have been any nicer and attentive!!!

We have been wanting to try this place since it reopened with new name. It was ok, nothing to really go crazy about. My food was good, not great but one side of my order was warm and the other side was a little warmer. I like my biscuits and gravy hot. Maybe get the microwave fixed!! The gravy was good but again, it was warm on one side of the plate and hot on the other. If it was hot food, I would have given it a 4 star. Waitress[ she was ok] gave me a refill on my drink when I was ready to leave. Too many other places to go eat hot food. Ambience is great. Takes me back to my diner days when we all went to a diner in NY. Water is terrible tasting. Kind of like maybe regular sink water, I noticed that other people left their water too. you might want to order a soda or coffee!!

This review is long overdue.

Used to eat here back when I lived in Las Vegas - also when it was Ivan and Gina running the place. I recall really enjoying the food as well as their company/service but heading there for dinner last Saturday with a friend and my parents, I didn't really know what to expect. 

Good food and excellent service is what I got. 

I ordered the Combo plate: kalbi, meat jun, BBQ chicken, rice and macaroni salad. I loved everything but the kalbi. Something about it - no other way to describe it other than I've had better. It was cooked, so I'm not sure if it was the marinade or the quality of the meat - but my friend didn't like it as well and my parents didn't even try it.

The service was awesome. Gina was her usual hospitable self and even brought out some special dishes for the table. 

Everything was awesome except the lack of parking and the kalbi. If I lived in Las Vegas, I'd be a regular for sure; in time, the duke.

Family wanted to eat from the hotel so we ended up ordering takeout from this place and I went to pick it up. The pricing was KILLER and since some of my family is on Keto the ability to just get soup/veggies/protein without the noodles etc was a great option. Ended up picking up a beef and fish ball soup with a veggie plate (added some extra meat). Also picked up extra soup as well. The soup itself was delicious but a little salty but still very tasty. The meat was deliciously tender and the fish ball was a hand made one not one of those processed fish balls. Both were cooked well and tasted awesome. Overall, this place is a great quick and hearty meal with super nice folks serving you.

EVERYTIME I'm home in Cleveland I have to get the Sunday pizza special that has been the same special for at least 10+ years.  3 topping pizza $9.99. It's yumma pizza.  Not the best ever but it's HOME and a great family owns this place!  It's so mom and pop and it's HOME!   Thanks again guys for making my trip home yummy!

This pink and wood-lined building has been an iconic resident of Old Town Scottsdale for as long as I can remember. While they've been there,  they've been serving some of the sweetest Ice Cream treats for many many decades.

Yes, Ice Cream Purists always downgrade them for being antiquated and serving "Dreyer's" Ice Cream. However, the multitudes that line the busy streets waiting to get in here on Friday and Saturday nights appear to be contrarian to such elevated Ice Cream perspectives.

Honestly, we come here often. Even if it's just to have a scoop of Ice Cream. We often sit by the bar and just enjoy each other's company. We always order different flavors so that we can share in each other's delightful selection for the evening.

It's nostalgic in the sweetest of ways. An Ice Cream Parlor that still engenders happy feelings of our youth. I first took my wife to Sugar Bowl during one of our dates many years ago. 

Don't come here for the food. The food really isn't what this place is about. You are going to get pretty standard diner fare, and might not like what you get. You come here for ice cream sundaes and the atmosphere of the soda shops of yesteryear. 

We will always love Sugar Bowl.

Listen. It's a chain. They've been around a for while. But it's not always a negative thing. The service was excellent and my steak was perfect, so there's no knock against them for that!

My husband wanted to come here for our anniversary. Since I dictate about 90% of the restaurant choices we make, I figured this was my anniversary gift to him! I was pleasantly surprised how nice of an experience it was. 

They semi-recently remodeled and moved their bar to the lobby of the PNC building. It throws you off a little, but they must have needed the room for more seating? Although I will say, I made our reservations online a couple days before on a Friday night with ample time slots available. It still has that same dark decor and ambiance it used to have. I would have figured they'd mix it up a little, but hey, they have a brand/image they want to go with, so I can't fault them.

My tomato salad was good, and thankfully had some fresh tomatoes, even at the tail end of tomato season. I ordered the filet, and like I said, it was perfect. It was a pretty large filet and I devoured the whole thing. No regrets on that. We ordered the cauliflower app, and although they said there would be capers in it, there definitely wasn't. The dish missed something without them. The scallop potatoes were cheesy goodness though, so that made up for the bland cauliflower. 

Our server was friendly and really good about accommodating me being gluten free. A handful of items on the menu are GF, so it's super easy to navigate. They even gave us a complimentary ice cream dessert for our anniversary. 

Happy we had such a great experience at an established restaurant.

Ah, my love hate relationship with this buffet. I've been here a few times now and it's always a great idea until afterwards when I get home and my tummy is rumbling. Maybe it's the mixed of different things at one time or just plain overeating, but whatever it is my stomach just does not agree with this place.

Selection wise they really have a little bit of everything - salad, sushi, egg rolls, cream cheese wontons, coconut shrimp, crab legs, broccoli chicken, and anything else you can think of. The price is also super reasonable too, but they do charge around $2 for soda/tea so if you're looking to conserve some money, stick to water. 

It's still a go to every now or then when my boyfriend and I are just feeling extra fat and craving Asian food, but it's not somewhere I'd go on the regular.

The service by our bartender was fantastic.  Would have never thought to order a Bloody Mary here but my friend did and it was surprisingly delicious!  When ordering the cucumber special roll be sure to say cucumber special, or you will end up with the cucumber roll hand wrapped in seaweed and not a cucumber and not as yummy.  I loved The Plaza Roll and it could have been spicier, the jalapeño on top is a nice touch. I gave four stars as the tuna sashimi was not very good and was but very thick.  You can't beat the buy one roll, get one free.  Highly recommend Akahana in Plaza Midwood.

Growing up I was deprived of many things other children got to enjoy. I never went to Disneyland. I never went to Chuck E Cheese. And of course I never played laser tag. Did I cry? Yes many many times. Lol but I had the beach and the outdoors so I was alright. It just meant I got to enjoy these things as an adult.

I like the setup they have at Laser Quest. In the front they have some arcade games, a couple of hoop games, and an area where they have parties. You walk up to the counter and give them an code name, some name you want to be called. Pick an awesome name. The staff there were very friendly and helpful. When it's time to play laser tag you're brought into this room and explained all the rules. Then you're given your laser tag equipment and it's time to go. During the game when you're shot the name of the one who shot you will show up on your gun. Hunt them down and get them back. It's so much fun and open for all ages. Kind of felt sorry getting all the easy scores. After the game is over they'll announce everyone's names with scores and put up on a board for bragging right. You'll also get a print out of who you shot and who shot you during the game.

They had a deal where you can play all day for the price you'd pay for about 3 games. I was so tempted to get it after playing my 2nd game. Another time. I'm going to be a laser tag dork now.
