Don't judge me. In case you were wondering I'm not that great. I got a lot of people but they got me a lot more. I was near last place on both games. I got beat by little little people. I'd be back.

You won't find many places like The Strip. The energy level is incredibly high and you never know what or who you will see. For example, after leaving Harrah's at 6:30 a.m. and wanting nothing but sleep, I ran into Hey for Jim (see picture).

He told me he came to Vegas from his reservation two weeks ago and I was the first person of 400 to shake his hand. I asked myself if I was friendly or stupid. Surprisingly, he didn't ask for money. What he wanted was something very different (not that, you freak). :) 

He wanted me to spend the day with him on The Strip to go up to people on their phones to let them know they were ruining society and that we needed to go back to being human again. 

I told him it was a great concept but this was Sin City and people wouldn't care. I then told him I had to get some sleep. He shook my hand goodbye, but it was a trick. Once he had my hand, he squeezed tighter and wouldn't let go. 

At first, I squeezed harder and planned how to disarm him, but the endgame for that option ran through my mind (potential blood exchange and/or jail). Instead, I made my hand completely limp, which he didn't expect and allowed me to slip my hand away. 

Surprisingly, he was sad, not angry. I think he wanted a friend. I told him I'd see him later. I did see him later that night but I didn't approach him. He was drunk and tossed a cardboard sign onto Las Vegas Blvd that read: 'Native. Please Help!' 

Strange experience but much better than sitting on the couch watching television.

Shabu shabu is a nice and cozy place to eat a mid-tier hot pot. The staff is great, knowledgeable, and sure to take care of you well. 

For the food, the drink menu is surprisingly diverse, containing standard Chinese drinks likes suanmeitang (sour prune drink). The hot pot is good, although the soup for the spicy base could have more flavor, and portions for the dishes are plentiful. Oh yeah, the dishes are all-you-can-eat as well, which makes for an interesting and bountiful eating experience. The sauce bar is decent, although a bit limited. They have the basics, like sesame paste, hot chili, salt, etc. but I feel like there could be other sauce options that aren't just salty and spicy.

Your hot pot temperature is controlled by yourself, and the experience is just great. You get the cook your own food and eat it exactly how you like it. Overall, definitely impressed by the restaurant, and would be happy to come back for another run at hot pot soon.
Round 3 getting Green Tean icecream covered in their chocolate fountain. The chocolate hardens on the icecream like yum!

Ok well the service is slow tonight, but they apologized for their slow service which was ok. But when the food came, omg everything was delicious!
We ordered: 2- Chicken Satay, 2-Calamari, Pad Thai, Fish, Fried Rice, and Beef Curry and for dessert, we devoured the Sticky Rice with Mango.

I regret that Thai Iced Tea. It was good but I'm lactose. Lol

Awesome 10 percent discount.

For the woman's restroom, it has a tall mirror with good lighting for a selfie lol

Every order we received, delish! Thank you!

Every time I go to an AMC, I kick myself for not going to a Harkins instead.  As soon as I walked in the place smelled like burnt popcorn, that should have been my first clue to leave.  I stood in line and waited my turn to get a soda and popcorn and my buddy went to go find us some seats.  When it was my turn I told the guy working the counter that I didn't want any of that burned popcorn and he said they threw it out.  Unfortunately, they have a do-it-yourself soda dispenser and so after you wait in line to get popcorn and a cup for your soda, you have to wait in another line to fill the cup.  This has got to be the worst idea ever, people struggling to balance their popcorn and snacks while working a touch screen with a 100 different soda selections, what a clusterfuck.  I finally get to my seat as the movie starts and I lean back in my chair and it gives out this loud screech so I make a mental note to sit upright the entire movie.  Then my friend starts moving around in his seat and it's also squeaking so I razz him about finding the two loudest chairs in the theater but as time passes I realize that ALL the seats in the theater are in desperate need of WD-40, it was like a symphony of squeaky seats.  Already, the experience isn't going well but then I nibbled down the top layer of popcorn and I realized that the rest of the back was small overcooked kernels.  I spent the next five minutes debating whether or not to miss part of the movie so I could go lay into these swill merchants.  I decide against it because the movie did cost more than the popcorn although they were both ridiculously overpriced.

I really liked King's Kitchen, especially the mission behind it. I would just choose a different entree the next time I went.

To start, the pimento cheese is REALLY good. House-made, served along side delicious bread. 

I had the NC Fried Flounder Calabash. It was cooked well, but there was just very little flavor. Not a whole lot of flavor in the coleslaw either. I grew up on Calabash style seafood and this just didn't hit the mark for me.

A friend ordered the pan fried chicken and another ordered the braised pot roast - both looked great and I didn't hear any complaints. 

They are just wine and beer now, but they had a really great selection. I'd love to go back and try something different.

This place is basically a Greek Chipotle. It's new. It's clean. It's fast. It's reasonably priced. It's fresh. The food is....okay. If you want a quick lunch and prefer something better than a fast food yuck burger then this place is a great option. If your wanting flavorful, authentic Mediterranean food this isn't it.

I visited here a couple of weeks ago for the first time. It's a small restaurant but with good service and very good ramen noodles. It was in the middle of the week that I visited so it wasn't very busy so there was just one waitress and she gave great service. 
I had the Miso Vegetarian Ramen w/Egg Noodles and the chicken karaage. The miso broth was so creamy delicious with lots of vegetables and perfect noodles. The chicken karaage was crunchy and delicious with a really good dipping sauce. Overall everything was awesome and this would be my go to place for ramen again and since it is close to where I live and also because I loved the egg noodles and the broth was delicious and there was so many ingredients in my bowl.

They charge extra, almost double amount and don't explain why they are doing it. They make customers wonder and wonder, when they should state WHY they are charging you so much on their bill. Don't let you know when you have rating. CALLED in and got no apologetic behavior. 

It's a great paper, but they obviously don't seem to value their customers.
Nice location with a side patio to enjoy your drinks. I got the Pumpkin latte. Was pretty good! Friendly staff as well.

The first time I was here with my boyfriend was for a quick drink. There was a list of Asian-inspired drinks, and I had one with calamansi, which I absolutely loved. We really liked how small and intimate the place was and the decor!

The second time I came was with two friends for dinner. Together, we ordered three dishes and we were satiated. We had the pineapple pork bun, the taro nest and their version of a hainanese chicken rice.

Fortunately, we were able to order one more bun, instead of have to share two buns amongst three people. The meat was incredibly soft and the bun was flakey.

The taro nest/bird's nest is vegetarian, with the option to add meat. It tasted similar to something you could get on Chinatown, but slightly saltier. Our favourite was eating the taro nest!

My favourite dish in the world is Hainanese chicken rice made in Singapore. To my surprise, they had their version here which was somewhat similar and very rich in flavour. Our rich was also rich, but slightly salty My only complaint was that it was so good, I wish I could have ordered two plates. 

Overall, we enjoyed our time here, and I really enjoy the ambiance and the cute logo.

Strike 2... 2 days and 2 locations of Chatime that just couldnt do a simple good bubble tea.  I feel their quality has been slipping a lot lately and this drink was definitely sub-par. Unlike the early reviews of Chatime, I didnt see any line up at all.  With maybe only one family before me, this spot was empty unlike the other really popular spot (Real Fruit).  

Chatime was one of the original first imports of the really good Asian bubble tea spots.  They've opened a lot across the GTA in the past few years and hitting up most of the malls.  I feel this location really does a disservice.  Sure it's not the terribly fake powdery stuff of eons ago but this was just a really bad drink.  This is a purely take out counter with not many seated areas nearby.  There was only 4 small tables in the shared hallway for the Timmy's, Tsujiri and Chatime.  It does have a few snacks as well but bubble tea is their main focus.  Well, used to be.

Service here is polite and quick... almost too quick.  My drink was made within a minute and though there was no wait... I feel with no pressure to send out drinks, this should have been made a lot better.

Brown Sugar Roasted Black Tea - With less ice and half sugar, I figured the roasted black tea would have been a nice rich flavour and the milkiness be creamy.  What I got instead was a super watery milky lack lustre tea... actually, I couldnt taste tea.  That was a complete shock.  Though it wasn't sweet, it was also super watery.  It was missing the milkiness that I used to find in the Chatime drinks.  Another sad thing about this drink was the bubbles. The previous day I didn't get a lot of bubbles and they werent done well compared to other brands.  Today, they were definitely over cooked... they were mushy.  This is no where as good as it used to be.  2/5

There are 3 spots for bubble tea in the mall and this one has dropped to the bottom.  I'll try the other one but I really doubt any could surpass the Real Fruit. They do have a line up but there's a good reason for it.

You can never go wrong with this place, especially if you love Persian food like I do! I've only been here once, and because the food was so delicious, I will definitely come here again. My favorite dish is the Beef and Chicken Koobideh. I gave this a try because I wanted to see how the chicken and beef tasted, and it was so good! The entree came with rice, beef, chicken, whole grilled tomato, and a serrano pepper with butter on the side. I really enjoy the fact that they give you butter on the side to mix in with your rice. It makes the rice that much better. They also serve you warm naan/pita bread. I suggest ordering a side of hummus, it's really good!

This place is new, clean, and spacious. Being inside made me feel like I was in a Persian home. The decorations / furniture is fancy. This is a great place for large groups. Highly recommend!

Picanha Steak Truck is one of the better quality food trucks in Vegas. I got to try this truck at the 2016 Great American Foodie Fest and I loved it!

The Picanha can be served on your choice of salad, tacos, by itself, etc. Your picanha steak has a temperature choice of "rare", "medium rare", "what are you doing?", or "f***ing ruin." 

I chose the Picanha Plate. It was served will picanha steak, caesar salad, and fries. I ordered rare steak, but it was probably medium cooked.....although it was still really soft and delicious. The caesar salad was amazing and I would honestly come back to get the Picanha Salad. The fries were okay, but they were very salty so I couldn't eat them. 

I love their food, just had a bad first experience. But now I know what I like from this food truck so I'm sure to order the right thing next time!

When you walk in through the main door, the first thing that catches your eyes are the fresh flowers...small pots of flowers, succulents, and of course bouquets of various arrangements of the season at Trader Joe's price!

Trader Joe's is a great place for produce. Most of the produce options are packaged in small quantities in plastic bags or mesh netting...so if you are looking into buy bulk, it's better spend money at Costco, but if you need just couple of days worth of them, this is perfect grocery store for you. You can always find Organic and Non-organic options, and the seasonal fruits and vegetables are always good.

TJ's carries some ethnic products that you wouldn't necessarily find at most grocery chains. Their ready-to-eat lunch items are very popular, especially their Salads and Wraps, which they rotate frequently, so you know for sure they are fresh. TJ's frozen foods are better than most, and work well in a pinch if you can access a microwave at work or school. Most of their fish is frozen and vacuum sealed, so we don't generally make many seafood purchases, though we have been known to pick up a set of crab cakes from time to time. And while they don't have the largest selection of greeting cards around, they are some of the most inexpensive options you'll find. You can grab a card from the check-out line, or browse their entire selection next to customer service. 
    
Oh, and customer service!  If you can't find something or need help to locate a certain product, the staff will drop everything (gently, and safely) and assist you, all the while, they are doing it with a smile and enthusiasm! 

Parking is plentiful and this store is spacious so it's easy to mosey around the inside the store, without the stress of many other grocery chains.

-2018 review #27-

"Take it off..... I wanna love you,
.... and everybody - wanna touch you.

You movin' right,.... wanna see what's up under,
Then back it up - BEEP BEEP like a trucker!

Nice thighs,.... nice waist.
And you know I can't forget about your face.

But don't none of that matter.....
I'm about to make your pockets fatter.

Girl I just wanna see you STRIP RIGHT NOW 'cause it's late babe,
Girl I just wanna see you STRIP, girl take your time with it.

Girl I just wanna see you strip damn you're seXy (for me)!
God damn you're seXy! (baby) damn you're seXy!

Chris Breezy - "Strip" ^ _________________

For what it's worth Yelp, there ain't NOTHING "breezy" about the LV "Strip" & I assure you, after a few days around this part of town your pockets will be ANYTHING BUT FATTER!

Beep Beep!!!

Easily the largest pros of Las Vegas begin here, at The Strip. Just as ironic as the lyrics to this song, those pros are nonetheless curtailed immediately thereafter by the inundation of cons that seem to tailgate from behind.

I consider the "nice thighs & nice waist" to this "brick house" of a stretch in pavement to undeniably be ALL THAT THERE IS TO DO HERE!

I mean, really: WHATS NOT LEGAL ON THE STRIP?!

Oooh, it's the LIGHTS --- ACK'SHUN... Oh, wait. That's Hollywood! My bad. My bad.

Once, while oh, I dunno - some place Strip-side, I trotted out to valet with my super sized Patron margarita in hand. I'd honestly forgotten all about it seeing as how you can even drink inside of Target & regretfully I offered to toss it out but not before the valet driver responded, "Dude. I couldn't care less if you took it with you or not. I'm just valet & I work for tips!"

THIS ^, ladies & gents, is the LV Strip & damned if my 3D driving experience thereafter didn't just afford this place it's 5th star!

Gone' head Vega$$$!

Notorious for its glitz & glamour, this is truly one of those love it or hate it types of places. When traveling in, no doubt with your paycheck in tow YOU LOVE IT to death, but upon departing, a nicotine stenched, broken down, desert hungover wreck of a hot mess - YOU HATE IT!

From the Luxor with its beaming ray of light that's actually viewable from outer space..... all the way down to Wynn, Caesar's, Mandalay Bay, SLS & the Stratosphere, your Bucket List just isn't complete without a stop off here!

Years ago, my sister moved out this way to attend UNLV.

Let's just say that she NEVER RETURNED!!!

Inevitably my fam- and I found ourselves frequenting "The Strip" almost weekly and I was more than enabled to explore virtually every hotel, time share and resort that this town had to offer one by one. 

I ain't a hotel whore for nothing y'all & don't even get me on my parent's "Elvis Wedding" vow renewal.

Lawd' have mercy...

The funniest thing would be that years later, in terms of entertainment, N-O-T-H-I-N-G  HAS  CHANGED!!! It's just as much of a thrill to visit The Strip now & unlike one's virginity: EVERY TIME YOU VISIT THIS PLACE SEEMS LIKE ITS YOUR FIRST TIME! The adrenaline rush hits you no sooner than the heat does & without a doubt do you know:

------ ITS GOING DOWN!!!

* I've seen Toni Braxton perform on The Strip!

* I've seen Mariah Carey perform on The Strip!

* I even hit up Tao and met Snoop Dee-Oh-Double Geezy here!

* Thanks to the thin single pane windows at SLS, I even heard Taylor Swift perform while overnighting on The Strip!

No doubt, are my memories of this joint insurmountable (& thanks to Magnums, hand sanitizer and morning after pills, those memories don't come with monthly child support payments!)

Yet, ...EACH & EVERY time that I visit, I find myself entranced by all of the new developments, further solidifying the fact that it's IMPOSSIBLE to run out of things to do here!

Prices here surge!

Traffic is a cluster----! 

& the entire vicinity is packed with people....ALLLL in search of additional methods towards TAKING YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY, but as we all know, that's the price you pay for life on "The Strip".

Ohhh, Strip. Smh. You're such the tease.

From gas prices or plane fare just to get out here, to the price of one's lodging accommodation itself. From there to the resort fee(s) ...pause for a moment. What the heck is even up with that fee? 

Can anyone make heads or tails of it? 

It's 2017 & WiFi should be free. There. I said it. Add to that, the cost of food, the slots & your choice of entertainment & you're left with a reason to mortgage your home OR BECOME THE NEXT LOCAL WHILE SLIDING DOWN A POLE TO REVAMP YOUR ACCOUNT!

Then, there's the cost of tipping.

As it appears, EVERYONE has their hand out. 

The valet guy. The bell man. Room service. You name it. If the slots & the harlots don't successfully 'jack all of your chedduh', I'm willing to wager that one of the above others will & in turn, here's your "Wheel of Fortune".

Come here with infinitely stacked pockets, a tetanus shot & an open mind!, & as ALWAYS, do NOT forget to FILL YOUR TANK IN ADVANCE!!!

Cha-ching! 

$$$

Classic hotel is Vegas. One of, if not the oldest hotel on the strip. Casino floor is awesome as the floor is huge and carries a great atmosphere. Casino is clean and is located in a prime spot on the Strip.

I don't quite get the vitriol against QJD. I've never been to the one in Beijing but (a) I have had duck in Beijing, and (b) I've had duck here in Canada (and other places), and this was one of the better ones. Also, the service we got was really attentive/informative and contributed to us so enjoying our lunch. 

Anyway, we were 3 people and got:
- Peking Duck (half portion) with steamed pancakes: This is what QJD is known for and it didn't disappoint. The duck skin was crisped nicely, the duck meat was tender/juicy without being fatty, and the side pancakes had a good neutral taste and were firm enough to hold everything in. More expensive than other Peking ducks I've had but also better.  
- Jelly (in vinegar sauce): Weirdly crunchy. As in, our friend who wasn't eating it commented that it was crunchy because he heard it as we munched haha! Tasted like the regular jellyfish but again, had that weird crunchy texture.
- Mapo Tofu: Great tofu texture but overly spicy taste (and we even had it at less spice).
- Scallion Pancake: This was my least favourite. Heavy and too oily for me.
- Fried Squid (in pepper and salt): This was really good. The squid was cooked well (not rubbery), the coating/batter was light, and the level of seasoning was perfect.

Overall, we had a good experience at QJD. May not be back because of the cost, but definitely don't regret spending to try it once.

I wish I could give them 2.5 stars.  It's better than meh, but it's not a-ok.

There is a lot of nasty Chinese food in Pittsburgh and the Sesame Inn is better than most, but sometimes it's very, very bad.  I'm talking about the Station Sq location.  The Sesame Inn in Mt Lebanon is consistently delicious.

I do like getting lunch here because it's quick, it can be healthy (shrimp & broccoli), and it's around $10.  I will absolutely be back because man cannot live on Subway 5x a week and there aren't too many affordable lunch spots in Station Square.

Would I drive all the way into town to dine here?  Nope.  

Also, I have seen some kind of strange things here.  One time the two hostesses in the front got into a loud argument in Chinese, and then there was the time I walked by the restaurant and there was a server that was either passed out, napping, or dead at a table right in front of the window. 

That kind of set the bar low for my expectations of their service.

DeLuca's is a quintessential diner. They have everything you would expect on their menu from pancakes to eggs Benedict. I had the biscuit and gravy with eggs when I came and enjoyed it, although the sausage gravy wasn't the best I've ever had. Overall, I had a nice experience here and enjoyed my food and the old-school atmosphere in the heart of the strip. It's a must-visit when you're in Pittsburgh.
@ Wow! Sun...for the moment! Cold water, and lemonade abound. Food. EVERYWHERE. My Fellow Foodies and I won't starve. Really cool, interesting crafts and art.

Great experience. Gerald was an awesome salesman. I spoke to him on the phone before we came in and met him at the store. He knew what we were looking for and wasn't pushy at all. He showed us what was on the best deal that matched our needs, then let us browse on our own. We ended up going with the refrigerator he originally showed us, and the whole process was easy and seamless.

Typical Korean BBQ , it's about time Charlotte got one . I think it's personally overpriced for the quality of meat you get and the types of bonchon but I'm use to this type of food so I'm being more strict , and eat Korean bbq alot.

I gave it 4 stars bc the service was great and fast, they had many workers attending to the tables . If you have kids, come during the day bc I can easily see this being a crowded spot for adults at night. Parking is horrible. 

Only suggestions I would make is explain the sauces and bonchon to those that arent familiar with Korean bbq in detail. Make your cheese corn larger with better cheese.  Peel the shrimp and add salt and pepper, get some regular soy sauce on the table for kids .

Their menu is very limited but what they make is very good.   If you don't like Swedish meatballs, salad, or salmon then it's probably not for you.  Their deserts are also a good choice. The mac and cheese is also excellent.  They have several kids meals.   It's cafeteria style eating off trays.  Prices are very reasonable.

It's so unfortunate that there are good techs that work here but the management and customer service sucks. I made an appointment, but they were running late. 10 min, 15 min, then 25 min. I understand that business gets busy, but at least inform your customer that nobody can get to me? At least give a time frame? Isn't that SUPER BASIC customer service 101? Communication? Don't put me in a chair and keep me waiting that long if you have no techs to service. I don't understand what is so difficult about that. Burned a long time local customer.

This review is long overdue because we had such a fantastic dinner experience at Patria. We were out celebrating, and our server made our evening super special. Service was excellent and well timed, and our server made really good recommendations. 

We had almost an embarrassing amount of food, but it was so good, so no shame! We shared the pan cote boquerones, bacon wrapped dates, croquetas de seta with ham, manchego and truffle aioli, queso frito and paella patria. I told you it was a lot of food! We demolished everything, but the standouts were the bacon wrapped dates and croquetas. The paella was delicious too. Finally, we had the churros for dessert, which was the perfect end to such a fantastic meal.

I'm so happy that Toronto is getting more of these "dollar stores" that Asia has. They offer many items for $2, and its just a great spot to check if, if you need little nick nacks for the house - Ill definitely be back!

Lunch $12.95 steal of a deal -includes drink. 
Desserts are pretty tasty. I don't think culinary but creative and definitely choices are abundant. 
Today they had turkey dinner and beef at the cutting table. Mongolian beef and a veggie chinese dish. Pork red pepper sauce tostados. Trout, cheeses and dim sum. Corn chowder (off the hook) 

A manager walked by to ask us about our experience.  I really feel this casino is pushing to really be dynamic in its choices and for its customer base. 

The lunch price and the quality of meats sold us.

I LOVED this place!! Finally a place that does everything right!!! From the tips on the dremel to the color selection to the desire to want to please their customers!!! The staff was so sweet! I loved Holly, Jade, and Dan! I loved the way Jade shaped my nails and most importantly the place was very clean as well as the instruments they used!!! I'll be back!

Just prior to Christmas I visited 3030 with some friends for dinner just prior to a Christmas party we were attending later that evening. I'd heard rumblings of this Junction mainstay across the Yelpiverse and was tickled pink when I heard that this was where I'd be dining this evening.

The decor of this place is very laid back with a certain retro sheen to it (namely because of the 1970's living room set up as soon as you walk in). Aside from that its a pretty unassuming place, great stage set up towards the back for live music, a simple bar to the left. Cool place!

Their beer selection was awesome with many varieties I'd not had (or not had in awhile), I opted for something new and I found myself guzzling down a pint of the Hops and Robbers IPA. It was interesting as it had the IPA hoppy finish with a touch of a fruity beginning. Very different and on my list of faves.

Before I get into the menu items we partook allow me to shed some light on a couple of points. First, they have 2 menu's, one is exclusively for their appetizers (all of which are $5) as well as a menu for their entrees. Secondly, there is a curtain about 1/2 way across the restaurant which is pulled off to the side and it's purpose is to separate the full menu side of the restaurant from the appetizer only side. We literally were the first seat on the wrong side of the curtain and the server wasn't going to serve us entrees - lucky for us the head chef and owner were sitting next to us and pulled some strings to have us served. Bonus!!! Thanks again!

The following was shared amongst 3 diners, we all left stuffed!

Appetizers 

Mixed Mushroom Tart - $5 (x2 orders)
- Light and fluffy tart base (just a little crispy) covered with a mix of mushrooms lightly sauteed and seasoned. LOVED IT!

Butter Chicken Wings - $5 (x2 orders)
- Served 4-6 @ a time, these were cooked and sauced in a way that made me salivate more with each bite. Cooked perfectly and covered in butter chicken curry sauce. I literally licked the plate clean!

Field Tomato Salad - $5
- Huge field tomato, green and red, sliced horizontally and done with a mix of what I believe was balsamic reductions and goat cheese mixed in at each level. A generous portion and very fresh on the taste buds.

Crab Cake - $5
- Light and crispy, not over cooked (hate it when that happens). Not overwhelmingly battered or crabby. Another winner.

Entrees
Beef Cheeks - $18
- My first time ever trying beef cheeks and so I wasn't sure what to expect. So tender and cooked/seasoned beautifully. This dish did not last long! MUST ORDER!

Tagliatelle - $18
- Flat Italian egg noodles tossed with a symphony of mixed mushrooms. The portion size was crazy generous and more than one person could comfortably finish on their own. Loved it - so happy when non italian restaurants can pull of italian cooking perfectly 

Compliments to the chef - he was a super nice guy and his menu was amazing. This is a great spot to come with a group of friends and just dine right off the appetizer menu. 

I can't wait to come back here again!!

We love Melting Pot and have been to several locations but this was definitely my favorite! They have amazing service and I feel like the food is especially fresh here. We went last Saturday for my birthday and I couldn't have been happier with my overall experience. Our waitress didn't immediately greet us so the manager saw us sitting at our table for five minutes with no interaction and he came right over and got our drinks going and helped the waitress who was obviously busy. After that, she was very attentive and constantly bringing refills or drinks and sauces and constantly offered us more dippers for our cheese. The food was amazing (green goddess sauce for the win) and the chocolate s'mores Fondue was amazinngggg. I love the little waffles they serve you now to dip in your chocolate!! Restaurant was very clean and cute. Bathrooms are very nice. I would definitely come back here!

Annyeonghaseyo!

Cheat day approved. We always feel hustled at all of the high-price-point Korean restaurants in town. Out of all of the ones we have tried since moving to Las Vegas, Island Style did not let us down. You seriously get a ton of food for your buck and the food actually tastes good. If you are looking for a small portion, or tiny bite, this is not the place to go. 

You will not even believe the portion sizes here. HUGE. Even the banchan (Korean side dishes) were a generous, heaping serving. My boyfriend and I came here with our massive appetites and we were totally defeated. We ended taking home over 60% of the food. That's nuts, even for us. We decided that when we return, we will only need to order one combo plate and share it.

We really enjoyed the authentic Korean banchan selection. The salt boiled peanuts were shockingly delicious. I'm really obsessed with munching on those tasty little guys. Everything else was seasoned and pickled just right; tangy, slightly sweet, and not obnoxiously spicy. They offered - kkakdugi (pickled daikon radish), kongnamul-muchim (bean sporuts), kimchi (pickled cabbage), cold seaweed, and also my absolute favorite was the addictive cheonsachae with mayo (white crunchy kelp noodles). Flavor rating: 5//5

My boyfriend ordered the meat combo plate that was about $12 - Its a crazy amount of food! It comes with 1 Kalbi rib, 1 meat jun, 1 thin breast of BBQ chicken and a big scoop of macaroni salad. We also substituted the white rice for spam fried rice. My favorites were the meat jun and the spam fried rice! We never had meat jun before, but it was so delicious! It's a seasoned hamburger patty covered in a tasty egg batter. The fried rice also had a bunch of spam. The kalbi had great charred and grilled flavor, but 1 rib didn't offer up enough meat; more of a tease. Also the grilled chicken was a tad bland. Flavor rating: 4/5

I really wanted something warm and comforting: a hot and spicy soup would hit the spot. I had my mind on ordering the Soondubu (hot and spicy tofu soup) but I later discovered that they only carry a seafood version, which I was not feeling at the moment. Our waiter was kind and recommended that I try the Yukgaejang (spicy beef and vegetable noodle soup.) I appreciated his tip, so I went for it. It came out steamy hot, the broth hit the spot. It was slightly spicy and very comforting, yet, it wasn't proportional; I wish there was more noodles, after 3 bites I was left with all veggies, some dry meat and a ton of broth. In the future I would definitely  request for extra, extra noodles. Flavor rating: 3/5

The SKIP list:  
* Spam musubi - The spam was sliced paper thin and there was way too much packed, dense rice. I ended up peeling off over half of the rice. Also, the dark, savory and sweet sauce to enhance the musubi was missing. Flavor rating:1/5

* Pan fried mandu, it came out soggy and the filling was exceptionally bland. Unfortunately, the dipping sauce didn't do much to enhance it. Flavor rating: 2/5

~Gamsahabnida!

Yay: cakes look nice, some unique flavors. Yuzu seems to be wife's fav

Nay: closes at 6 most of the days!?!?

Must just not be fate, everytime I seem to want to buy it is either on Monday, Tuesday, Weds or Sunday... 

Oh I guess any day besides Thursday, Fri or Sat...

Closes at 6, not sure who eats cakes before 6. But everytime I've just gone somewhere else. Guess I'll just default to somewhere else.

P. S. Daango has a great yuzu tart. Flavors are on par.

It was okay, sass is very tomato based. I had grilled chicken quesadillas they were okay. For an extra $2 for the chicken it could of been more flavorful. 

Waitress appeared overwhelmed and it took awhile to get a box and check. I came for lunch and maybe 15 people total so not overly busy.

Came here for brunch on the weekend! This is a nice addition to Oakland as there are not a lot of nicer sit down options around here. The restaurant is on the 10th floor and overlooks all of Oakland. The decor is very trendy. We started with the pain perdu to share. The food did take quite a bit of time to come, so if you are in a hurry be aware of that. The french toast presentation was excellent, but it also tasted delicious. I then had the dutch baby, which was unique as it had a fried egg on top of this pancake soufflé. My friends had the avocado toast and were very pleased as well. Overall, an excellent brunch in Oakland. Glad to see some not fast casual restaurants open in the area.

Before getting into the negative portion of my review, it is important to note, that Moses, Damon, and Demetrius were all great - worked hard, friendly, respectful, and really helped my husband and I out with our move this past weekend. As with any move, there were several items that were just slightly nicked and damaged (a curtain rod, the bed nightstand, a lamp shade, and some wall art). We appreciated that the team was clear and upfront about the damage that those items incurred. 

However, after the team left, we found that our flat screen tv was heavily damaged. Careful handling unfortunately was not the case for this item. It was packed and taped by the team, loaded and then unloaded, and then left in a room with the damage facing the wall and tucked behind some other items. This is not a case of the screen being scratched or the case being chipped, this is obvious damage that should have easily been noticed during unpacking. My husband and I found it odd that the team was very upfront about other damage, but the most damaged and most expensive item appeared to be placed away from immediate view without any notice.  

We reached out to Skinny Wimp to see what sort of coverage they offered for damaged items and unfortunately the basic insurance package that we were automatically enrolled in only covered $0.60/lb. No one ever intends to damage an expensive item, but I wish they would've told us that there were other coverage options -moving in and of itself is expensive, let alone having the unanticipated cost of having to purchase a brand new TV due to a bit of the movers' carelessness.

Been making and breaking reservations for over a month because my husband's schedule is gross. 
We finally made it last night. 

I've seen this place promoted so much and I LOVE Italian. 

We got there and had to wait awhile for our table, even with a reservation. The place was hoppin'.
We were sat and or waiter poured our water and ran off. He was clearly very busy. Due to that, we decided to order everything together. We got our appetizer pretty fast. 15 mins later, no drinks. 30 minutes later, still no drinks. We had seen them at the bar, he just wasn't bringing them. After watching him pour more wine for the table next to us twice, we finally asked him to bring our drinks. I hate having to do that. 

Dinner came out and the spaghetti was really good. The hubs got the Pachamama. It was good too, but very little veggies. It was like 1 brussel sprout broken into leaves. So you have a huge plate of meat and fat with nothing to offset. If you're Paleo, keto, etc.-- you're set!

We asked for another round of drinks. My husband asked before I did. Another 30 minutes of waiting and he had to remind the waiter again. 
When these things happen, we pay attention to see if they're waiting on other tables in ample time. He was. So it started to get frustrating. 

I mean, overall, the food was good. But when you have to ask to be waited on, it just puts a bad taste in your mouth. And no matter what, we still gave him 20%. It's hard to not tip well. I have only tipped very low twice in my life. One time being due to the waiter being blatantly rude. Our waiter was not rude. Just very unattentive. 
And when you're paying well over $100 for a dinner, not including your tip, you'd just expect/hope for better service. 


I doubt we'll go back for that reason, which is sad. 

Onto to next one.

Incredible! I can not wait to go back! The staff was so amazing and helpful. So many great things there! I could live in this adorable store! I would love to give 5 stars but it was very pricey. I feel like that is such a big factor for me to ignore but I'll still be in there to shop anyway! I'll just have to save a little more!
Has very limited space, great atmosphere, good authentic Vietnamese food. Great waiters.

I came here for Happy Hour after golfing in the area last month. The food is not the highest quality, but it's not terrible for the price. 

Happy Hour was busy, but the bar area had plenty of seating to accommodate this popular time. There were tables as well seats at the bar. We opted to sit at the bar and received good service from one of the bartenders. She took our order right away and continued to check in on us. 

The Happy Hour menu offered plenty of cheap drink and food options, more than I would expect for HH. Margaritas were only $3-$5 and food was under $5.

The chips and salsa to start were good. The beef enchiladas were my favorite item with plenty of beef filling and a decent queso on the side for dipping. The cheese quesadilla and beef taco were okay and the servings were decent for the price. The stuffed jalapenos were full of cheese and covered in breading, but not my favorite. My friend's margarita was the highlight of the HH.
Tonight they have chicken tenders and fried pickles. Along with checkin wings so it is a great combination of food. Great service and quick service on food

My husband and I popped in here for Happy Hour on a Thursday evening and had a great experience! Our bartender/server was SO attentive and made sure that we were totally taken care of. Our waters were never empty, we got extra chips for our queso when we were low, and our drinks were delicious! 

I ordered their cucumber/jalapeno margarita and it was so yummy! The perfect amount of kick. I tried my husband's house margarita as well and it was DELISH for a "house"! Typically they're too sour for me but this was perfectly balanced - so I ended up getting one for my second drink.

We also indulged in tacos. I loved the beef taco! It was only $2 on happy hour, yes please! My husband tried their beef, shrimp, and fried avocado tacos and loved them all. 

We will absolutely be back another time! It would be a great place to watch football in the Fall because they have loads of TVs and great sound! It is nice visiting the Scottsdale "row" when there aren't crazy lines everywhere and it isn't busy. I guess this might mean that i'm "old" now? :)

Highly recommend this place for barbeque.... Sweet and thick sauce..... Meats are done perfectly..... Juicy and not dry..... Potato salad was great..... If you go, make sure to get dessert too... Chocolate pecan pie rocks!.  Great service as well.... And great, comfortable atmosphere... Much better than Table 22 was....Will be going here again... And again.

Great place to hangout with friends. The atmosphere is more like a coffee shop than bar. Drinks are all reasonably priced but not necessarily the best tasting. 

The only thing refraining me from giving this place a higher rating is its cleanliness. Strange stains on their couches and dingy colored walls makes one wonder when was the last time they had a thorough cleaning. Probably a decade ago. Service is also mediocre and they do not do separate bills.

Great for coupons if you're a cardholder & my parents find many awesome, very inexpensive items cause of it.  Mom & I were looking for Roman Shades.

The blind/shades expert just stood there, shoulder length blond hair, Russian accent, didn't offer help just looked away.  I had to walk over & ask her, do you work in this department?  

She looked up the 40% off Roman Shades in 47' & we were thrown shade... $311 for one... What?  She said Roman Shades are very expensive, these were also made-to-measure and that it'd take at least two weeks, wtf?  I understand they are expensive, but I am looking for standard fitted ones.  If I wanted to have my whole house fitted for drapes that would be another story, which they've done for us twice so I do understand blinds & shades ma'am.  

We went to Bed Bath & Beyond around the corner & found the most amazing Roman Shades in excellent quality, colors & the blackout was included.  JC Penneys charges more for blackout or room-darkening blinds & shades.  Not to mention the 40% off discount at BB&B, I ended up buying four Roman Shades that were very simple to put up, look fitted and classy so read my review on BB&B for pix... grand total of $345!

Tina and Ed are amazing if you are planning a wedding or event with Bears Best! They love what they do and it shows. There are many locations on site to hold your get together and they help plan it unique to you. The course is beautiful with stunning mountain views.

My husband and I tried Open Rice for an early dinner. Service was friendly and the food was delicious! The restaurant is styled more like a quick-serve establishment, but it was still pretty nice and great for a laid-back date night or small group dinner with family/friends. 

They have a full bar, a large drink menu, and a good- sized menu selection ranging from apps to entrees. 

We ordered Dumplings for the appetizer and our dinner entree's were Beef Chow Fun and Char Siu Pork w/Fried Rice. Everything was delicious! 

Our server was very friendly and attentive. We'll go back many more time, I'm sure!

This is my new favorite restaurant!  Everything made from scratch and absolutely breathtaking perfect flavors and execution.  Everyone, including my 10 and 12 year old kids, wanted to try everything and loved everything.  Service is outstanding and craft beer, mixed drinks, and wine options are excellent.  

We had:
Shrimp Gabas - whatever was in the sauce was a nice balance of spicy, garlic, and tomato to accent the shrimp.  So good! 
Cuban - best Cuban I've ever had 
Fried chicken w Pork fried rice -  the chicken was the ultimate blend of crispy salty tasty crust with an insanely fresh and tender inside.  Everyone at the table was going bonkers for this one... and I haven't even gotten to the pork fried rice yet.  Absolutely perfect.
Mac n cheese - the waiter told us it was voted best 2x running and I couldn't agree more with those voters.  I normally don't care to order Mac n cheese at restaurants, but I will make an exception here.  Next time I'm putting some sriracha or hot sauce on the top!

Fresh fruit salad dessert w tajin - all fresh cut fruit, very simple item, but executed with love and care

The interior design was modern and hip, we liked the wall murals and unique decor.  

Will be back again and again and again!  Patio opening in the next 30 days (we visited 9/7).

Well this was a waste of time and money! I should have read my fellow Yelp reviews first before coming here, but it's right next door to my doctor's office so I thought I would give it a whirl! Ugh! 

The waitress was nice, hence the two stars! Otherwise I would have given it one star! However, the food was not flavorful and the rice tasted like Rice-O-Roni--you that San Francisco treat! The plate was hotter than my food! It's safe to say, I won't be returning!

Food is home and adventure for me. So naturally, I am drawn to explore any ramen spot that pops up. Nestled in the busy and happening area of the The Quarter, Obon is addition and surprise for this foodie zip code. Beautifully remodeled, management also plucked the pretty people to work here. Came here during lunch and every seat almost taken, we managed to snag a spot on the patio. Note to staff, heaters aren't needed in AZ when the sunshine is a warm 75. Service was a little spotty for the food but our server was friendly and warm. 

The menu is simple enough with 15 being the lucky number on most items. You have a variety of steam buns, ramen and sushi rolls to salivate over. We opted for the shoyu ramen and fukushu sushi roll. The serving bowls belied the content. The broth is good but not enough to make up for the lack of enoki mushrooms and scantly piece of pork shoulder. It took about 20 minutes before we got our sushi roll which was pretty delish. My belly was disappointed and still hungry. I'll cheer on any new foodie spot, particularly a ramen one. You won't be my first choice on the dance card but good thing you have happy hour too.

Soul is one of my favorite spots in Charlotte, but be sure to join the waitlist online before you go! They have great drinks, a variety of fantastic food, and a cool atmosphere. Order lots of different things from the menu - you can't go wrong here - whatever you get, it's sure to have you looking up at the people you're with saying "oh my gah that's so good," while nodding your head in happy agreement.

The best restaurant in all of Las Vegas. That's all this review really needs to say, but let me explain the reasoning behind my statement of fact. Hafez is just an amazing Persian restaurant with a menu filled with many different delicious entrees! Between my wife, my son, and myself we average Hafez near once a week to eat. We've been there nearly a hundred times in the past two years between the current location and the old one they upgraded from and it's ALWAYS perfect! The best dish in my opinion is number 20 the chicken skewers which comes with a nice healthy serving of the best perfectly cooked Persian rice, one quarter if an onion, a full roasted tomato, a quarter of lemon, and a roasted serrano pepper. Don't even get me started on the Taftoon bread it's to die for. I would literally drive to Hafez just for the bread and some butter in the morning. Everything on the menu is worth a try.

Closing statement the Bathrooms are the cleanest I've ever seen, cleaner than even the nice fancy pants casino restaurants.

What a step up from the previous Filipino restaurant at this location! Nanay's serves stick-to-your-ribs, hearty, comforting food, perfect for a chilly day! We came here around 11 AM for lunch and were the only customers here. As we left a few more people trickled in.

There were a lot of dishes to choose from, with a variety of meat (Chicken, pork, or beef). There was one section off to the side that had some crispy fish. I got a 3 item combination ($9.50) which included a plate of 2 scoops of rice. On the menu board it said soup was included so I asked which soup was part of the meal. The person helping us out said she could give me a little bowl of broth but not the other contents of the soup (Which included some greens and pork) so I'm not sure if soup is actually still part of the combo deal since my friend didn't get any extra soup for her 3 combination meal.

Each dish I had was very flavorful. I especially enjoyed the pork with coconut milk and green beans. Unfortunately I don't know the name of it but it was tasty! The kare kare and dinuguan I also had were enjoyable. My friend's chicken dishes were also quite good and the broth was lovely.

Drinks are by the can or bottle and include bottled water, Snapple, and various sodas. There is also a free-range container of iced water to serve yourself.

Service was good and the person helping us out was warm and friendly. When we entered the restaurant though the music (Tuned to a mix of "easy listening" artists like Barry Manilow) was cranked really high up to dance club level volume! They did turn it down a bit once I asked :)

I'll definitely come here again and I'll have to save room next time for halo halo!

This place was quite the treat! 

The restaurant is small but it helps you enjoy the magic that much more. Chef has a course menu and all you do is choose your meat of choice and a dessert. There are additional options available if you're looking to try more. 

We ordered the rib eye and the swordfish as well as some garlic rice. For the desserts we ordered the doriyaki and the black sesame ice cream which is my most favorite thing ever!!

Watching chef work his magic was beautiful. He truly takes his time and is the most clean I have ever seen! I am hoping to bring others here soon to enjoy the same experience I had. There was not one thing chef brought out that I didn't enjoy. 

I hope you will feel the same!

I've eaten here many times but mostly it was a drunk late night snack. Today I'm just hungry after the gym:) This is good pizza and they don't over charge for the slice!! I mostly pick one of the slices without meat of what's available and it's always good!

The atmosphere is unique but in a good way! I think it is really interesting on how they themed this cafe as if you really are from the time period that they're going for. There are plenty of chairs and tables surrounding the cafe, but it does tend to be very busy during peak hours such as lunch or after dinner. There is a huge variety of pastries and plates to choose from which all look very appetizing. Usually when I frequent here, I like to order their tea in their teapot which is aesthetically pleasing. The only downside to this place is the prices because I believe it is pretty expensive for what they actually are. Regardless it is a great place to hangout with friends.

I recently hosted a baby shower here. I have to say the experience far exceeded my already high expectations. The owner Rhonda met with us and helped plan everything. The food and service was amazing. The wait staff didn't have to be asked to do anything. They anticipated our every need. The food was perfect and prepared to order. I can't think of any way to convey how great it was. And how special it made the day. All our guests can not stop raving either. Thank you!

I ordered fried pickles and chicken tenders as my dinner. Been gambling and having fun but need eat  before I go to bed. These guys are great and allows great good food that is hot. I like to take to room and enjoy food.

Waited almost half an hour for a seat here because the  place is so small. There also doesn't seem to be any heating either which left me to keep my jacket on for lunch. The eggs here are suppose to be a highlight but I felt they were just okay...I preferred some of the other dishes we had instead. What I did appreciate was that there is no upcharge for cold drinks and the milk tea here was delish!

I've visited this location on a number of occasions (I'm surprised I don't have a review for it). 
We decided to go on a date night after seeing a movie, so unfortunately we arrived about 20 minutes before the last call for food. We basically had to guess at how much we would want (my poor husband was stuffed at the end). That was our fault though, so not a big deal. 
The food comes quickly and the quality is good. Not great, but still good. The shrimp dumplings are delicious and safe to eat. They are wrapped in rice paper and don't have any sauce. So don't let a waitress tell you they aren't gluten free because they are (I've received yes/no answers so many times on this. I've never gotten sick and would lose my entire stomach over half a pretzel so I know what has gluten). 
They do have gluten free soy sauce but it tasted weird to me. I usually bring my own to be honest. 
So for an AYCE experience it wasn't the best, but that was mainly due to the time constraints. The food isn't half bad but is very expensive. KB sushi is cheaper, has the shrimp dumplings on the lunch menu too and is higher quality

If you are in a rush or just on your way to work, walk-up window is highly recommended... less chit chat! I totally understand the whole perky, cheerful vibe and such but sometimes I just want to get my drink and get on with my day. I timed two visits, both were over 20 minutes! I gave a 4 star, drinks were good, presentation was clean (it better be, it took them long enough), customer service is always fabulous and my kids love this place!

Came on a Sunday 30 min after they opened, and the place was empty - no line, no waiting, just me staring through the glass at all their offerings. Finally, some delicious bbq that isn't overcooked or super overly seasoned. I enjoyed the pulled pork and the chicken - both moist and not bad for thr price. As some other have noted though, I would skip the banana pudding. There are no fresh bananas and it tastes like instant banana flavor pudding. Come here for the bbq and go to Rudy's for the banana pudding.

Delicious carnitas and salsas! I love that they sell by the pound. We are starting to buy these when having friends over this way we don't have to cook and tacos are always a great option for everyone!

This was my first time trying poke.  This location is in a strip mall in the university area, near one of my favorite medeterrian spots.  There were a few people ordering when I arrived so I took my time checking out the menu and the toppings.  I decided on a bowl with rice, cucumber, edamame, cilantro, mango, king fish, sauce, scallions, ginger, crab salad, avocado, shrimp.  It was definitely a different experience and not bad at all.  It was light and fresh with different degrees of heat depending on what toppings you choose.  I am now a fan of poke and looking forward to trying some of the other places in Charlotte that are opening all over the city.

Had a great dining experience at Times Square. Have been here about 6 times and am finally getting  through this very large menu with some favorites.

I had the Pasta Giovanni. The penne pasta has chicken sausage with mushrooms in a tomato cream demi glaze sauce with garlic and red pepper. It was a flavorful dish and had enough left for another meal.

Offspring ordered the Gnocchi. The potato dumplings are hand made and tossed in a maranara creame sauce. Very tasty and very dense. Other offspring had a side ceasar salad with a take home cheese pizza.

Other dishes here have been good. Great for Itallian and seafood. Reasonably priced and great service.

Literally the best chicken burgers I have ever ate.  They speak to my 2nd-generation-Asian-american soul with their Asian-american fusion of Korean food and burgers.  I ordered the FIRECRACKER (most popular pick) and the NASHVILLE HOT (their spiciest sandwich); firecracker was delicious, but the Nashville was not spicy to a seasoned-spice-enthusiast.  Their bomb dust fries were real good too.  The setting has a fast-food restaurant feel, but I guarantee those chicken burgers tasted gourmet.  

I am honestly not a big fan of most fusions, because it's a gamble with an individual's perspectives on "best quality of both world".  The Korean seasonings, the freshly cooked chicken, the large juicy quantity, and the perfect sides are all great indicators of my perfect fusion.  

They beat out Popeye's chicken sandwich and Chick-fil-A (might be an unpopular opinion, but i said it).  I plan to return to eventually try everything on their menu.  

I haven't been this excited for a burger spot for a while.

I'm giving three stars because after all it's only a fast food restaurant for crying out loud.  I never rave over any fast food. However it was good. Didn't have to wait long at all and the cashier was very friendly.   The store was very clean. I got exactly what I ordered no mess ups.

Very quick service. I am very picky about meat and my burgers so I wasn't expecting to be very thrilled. It was a nice surprise to have an awesome burger that I finished and was very satisfied with. Delicious!!!!! I had the Seoul! Loved!! Also the sweet potato fries and maple dip?!!! Outstanding!!

Ma première fois au Restaurant Bacaro 

Accueil charmant à la porte en rentrant et la personne qui fait l'accueil nous apporte à notre table et après notre serveuse vient nous voir si on veux avoir quelque chose à boire 

J'ai vérifié le menu de A à Z pour voir qu'est qui a comme entrées pâtes pizza ect y'a des bon choix ses Dur de décidé quoi prendre 

J'ai fini part prendre la pizza au olives noir et anchois à 16$ très bonne la pâte et mince et croustillante beaucoup d'anchois quelque olives mozzarella sauce tomate portion de 4 pointes ou si vous la coupe 8 petite pointes j'ai pris à boire un coke à 3$ 

Le service numéro un 
L'attente pour ma pizza environ 15 minutes raisonnable 
Prix bon

Love it here! Have been taking Winston here every time I am out of town for the last 5 years, highly recommend. They take care of the dogs like they are their own. They group the dogs by size for the play times, which I appreciate having a smaller dog. Lots of outside play time. Winston isn't used to playing with other dogs, but always does well here. They always send photos of the dogs playing while in house. And gave me multiple tours of the property to ease my nerves. It always seems spotlessly clean and well kept up. They are always ready to greet us when we arrive and seem very organized.

The food was eh. The service was ok. The house special margarita in a pitcher. The best margarita I've had. WOW! It was superb. I had the veggie quesilla and my cousin got the 3 tacos. Eh. Over-priced, lackluster. Both dishes. My suggestion, go get full somewhere else and then enjoy a margarita there!

OMG tonite the food was simply gross.  There must be a new cook because lord have mercy every dish was bad bad bad. Flavorless mushy saimin undercooked everything.  The teri sauce is definitely out of the bottle.  The worst thing is the place was filthy dishes on tables not wiped sticky tables seats dirty I don't know what happened to them but it's should be called Aloha anything

Stopped into this location for a bite to eat. Ended up getting some sushi to share after remembering that Wednesday is $5 sushi day! Sushi was ok, good value for $5, but don't expect it to blow your socks off. My biggest pet peeve is most of them tasted too much the same. The spicy California roll was probably the best - I found the others a little on the sweet end. The crab is more of "krab", at least with the shrimp you are getting real shrimp. 

Also ended up picking up a few goodies, they had the lowest priced cherries at 97 cents a lb, in ok condition. My biggest issue with Sprouts in general is the stores are very cramped and you are constantly moving out of the way or around staff and other shoppers. I prefer doing big grocery hauls for staples at a Fry's or Kroger because it's a more pleasant experience. I do have to say Sprouts tends to have the best selection of unusually produce and hard to get health items (second to Whole Foods).

We've been going here for years and I can't believe I've never left a review. I absolutely love everything I've ever tried and I've had all the vegetarian dishes. We've been coming to their all vegan buffet since they started it last month. It's all so delicous and you get so much food. All the staff is very sweet and friendly. We also like their prepackaged food as well and will load up on those for lunches during the week. Highly recommend!!

Unlimited noodles for $10!!!

DECOR: 5/5
Located in FMP, this place is pretty easy to miss among all the other dozens of restaurants in the plaza. The sign doesn't necessarily stand out but there's people standing outside which means, uh oh, there's a line. The inside decor is surprisingly very nice. The lighting is unique, the walls are decorated. Their chopsticks are even engraved. The only downside is that their restaurant isn't huge, and considering their popularity, you would wish it was bigger.

FOOD: 5/5
Bottomless noodles! There are a few different restaurants that serve this style of noodles, most namely Dagu. I did a bit of research comparing these two brands and apparently Yunshang is way better. The soup was served a unique clay pot, with all the toppings on a tray on the side. I ordered the curry coconut soup and my friend ordered the Tomato. We really liked them both! Despite being an option to add meat for $2.99, there is already a few slices of pork included in the toppings. If you do add extra meat, it'll come inside of your soup.
I also added a squid tentacle skewer for $2.99, which was a pretty decent price and it yummy, but it was soft and not as crispy.
In case you're not full, just ask for extra portions of the noodles and eat to your heart's content! There's plenty of soup to eat maybe two or three portions without running out.

SERVICE: 4/5
It was pretty busy on Saturday during lunch. We got there and were given a number in line, and a menu to write our order, and waited about 30 minutes. It was a nice day so it wasn't that bad. They're also pretty efficient with bringing your order pretty much as soon as you sit down. If you just make eye contact you can ask for extra noodles and theyre pretty friendly about it. The waiters mainly speak Mandarin but they'll accomodate for English too.
They accept cash and debit, but they took my credit card without any complaints/added fee (maybe too busy to notice).

Definitely coming back and recommending to my friends!

I absolutely LOVE this place, but there is one staff who does an excellent job but ruins the experience for me. This was my 2nd time with her. I have a high tolerance for pain (face piercings etc) but she hurts. They were under staffed this morning & turned away 3 customers after I walked in. I decided to give her a second chance, as I leave Saturday & return home (Canada) and like getting my pedi done before I go home.

She obviously does NOT mean to hurt but she has natural sharp nails that she uses to push skin down etc. And now my toe is sore, she cuts down to the skin to much. It's partially my fault, I should have said something but I don't want to be rude & hurt her feelings. 

I will obviously go back as I have been going there since they opened & they are a fantastic establishment. But I do not think I can give her a 3rd chance unfortunately.

Good quicky!

So I had this ramen craving when I woke up this morning. Put in a search, and got Arashi. located in the Montage Plaza off of Fort Apache, it's not hard to find with plenty of parking.

A warm Japanese greeting as we walked in, and seated right away. The decor is very homey, a comfortable and mellow feel. Very nice. 

What ordered:
Arashi Tantan Men
A sesame based pork chashu with egg, spinich, nori, bamboo shoots, mizua, chili oil, garlic, and green onion.

First things first, the richness of the broth is great. If you like a slightly bitter flavor in your soup, this is it. The quality of ingredients used in the soup is top. Together it made for a good soup. Definitely worth a stop when you need that ramen fix.

There are alot more on their menu that we will have to explore, but for now I'm well satisfied. Thank you Arashi.

LIVE Jazz was what brought us in! Walking around Tivoli Village realizing how small this "mall" really is (how disappointing) we were drawn in by the sounds of a LIVE Jazz band... Wait, LIVE and Jazz in the same sentence?! Yessir!!!

I've never known what the difference between a good or bad cigar, but leave it to my husband to teach me! I've NEVER come across a cigar that I was a fan of, NEVER. As I've told my hubs, "They all taste like Butt!!" and his response is always "You've tasted butt?!?! Eww!!" Ugh, booger. But he selected one Padrón, an anniversary series... Again-- never came across a cigar I liked-- 'til tonight. I now know about that taste that my hubs speaks of! 

Tonight's lesson: my new fondness of cigars + LIVE (capitalized bc the only other LIVE Jazz I've found is at the Cosmo) Jazz Band found locally + the lovely ladies on staff = our new Friday night hangout!!

Why the star deduction? Here it is:
One person, per use-- UNISEX restroom. Call me a "potty snob" but I find it pretty damn uncomfortable going in as a person of the other sex is coming out. I'm the only female in my household and growing up my brother and I shared a bathroom... As clean as my guys are, boys are kinda gross. As much as I want to think that the other sex washes their hands, wipes down the seat and doesn't adjust the jewels all nice and raw, I know damn well that they don't. Don't get me wrong, females are disgusting in their own right, but as nice, clean and easy on the schnozzola, it's just an uncomfortable situation for me.

Love, 
The Potty Snob ;)

Bought the Groupon to give Hot Yoga a try, and I absolutely loved it!  They have such a variety of classes and times that you will be able to find a class that works with your schedule.  If you have the chance to stop by here for their free week for new customers, or catch the Groupon deal...try it out!  You won't be disappointed.  As others have recommended, read the tips/tricks they list o their website before going and try to have ice water with you if you can.  I only went for the 30 days, but even in that short amount of time I noticed a difference!  I highly recommend trying some of the 90 minute classes (baptiste), you feel like a new person when you walk out of there...such a sense of calmness and accomplishment.

After acquiring some groceries at Safeway (many of which were perishable), we decided to swing through the Panda drive-thru for teriyaki / honey sesame chicken, eggplant tofu, and chow mein / super green dishes. Key point here is that the drive-thru was meant to save some time, as we had to get home to refrigerate our groceries. 

Upon ordering, we were told that the tofu would be another 10 minutes. No problem -- that's okay; I've waited for the eggplant tofu before, and on that occasion they were true to their word. This was at 4:33 P.M.

At 4:53 P.M., we were starting to wonder what was taking so long. In what galaxy does eggplant tofu take more than 10 minutes to make? How about even 5 minutes for that matter, being that the demand was relayed through the restaurant. Did they forget? Were they understaffed? We entered the building with the goofy drive-thru flag they gave us, so to ascertain what happened to our [up until this moment] convenient dinner.

A staff member arrived on the scene to inform us that the eggplant tofu would be another 5 minutes. For the wait to reach 25 minutes was already unacceptable, but what choice did we have? 

5 minutes later, the same staff member arrived to say, "So, the eggplant tofu is done, but now we're out of teriyaki chicken. It'll be 7-10 minutes." 

What.

I'm still on my health fix, so I wasn't keen on substituting the protein-rich grilled chicken for any other entree. However, we were damn hungry, so I asked to have my meal switched to honey sesame chicken (which I am delighted is back in circulation). Lo and behold, that chicken was also not ready. From the absence of one entree to two, to *three*, the unacceptable level was fantastically off the charts. 

When we finally got our order, we were asked if we wanted a drink for our time. Many thanks, but of course not. A drink? We spent over 30 minutes at Panda Express for an order that we expected to be ready in less than half the time. They were absolutely off-base today, and I received no good explanation as to why. This experience defeated the purpose of the drive-thru, and paired with perishable groceries and wolfish appetites, was the worst of Panda we've seen. 

Bad job. We'll plan on coming back when you've got it together.

I've been looking for some good Jamaican cuisine in Charlotte and finally found it. I met Quidley while there and he was super friendly and so happy to have people enjoy the food. He goes and personally picks out all of stuff from the market for his restaurant to ensure the best. The space is large actually and we were able to sit at the bar. We ordered jerk chicken, ox tails, yams, cabbage, and mac and cheese. It was all really good! I'll be back to try more items.

I've reviewed a lot of Greek places so I am reasonably familiar with what the over all flavor profile should be and this place is good. The gyro meat is similar to most other Greek places but their chicken is pretty remarkable.

It's in a tough spot, hidden behind the Christian Bros but i strongly recommend you give them a try.

This is a very nice park. My favorite thing is that the playground is enclosed. The playground could use some updates but it's still super fun for the kids. I don't see anything broken or dangerous. There is a walking path and a nice rock river. Very pretty, especially after it rains. You can see the water running in between the rocks. It's located next to a school so beware of pick up and dismal, parking can get pretty hectic. 
People love bringing their dogs here so there is plenty of dogs around. They have a large sand area that is intended to be used as a workout part of the park. After school kids take over that so that's also something to consider. There are a good amount of trees around the walking/ running path. They have a small area next to the playground where you can hold a party. It's fairly small and always busy so Maybe look into reserving the area if you want to use it for a party.

The people that frequent this place seem very nice. I've had two bad moments here with rowdy high schoolers. But maybe it's because of the cold but I haven't witnessed that for a while. Thats another reason why I love the gated playground, it's just safer and gives parents a little breathing room.

I discovered this place on Yelp and I was raring to visit because I love Korean Chicken. I finally got the chance to go when my friend and I were going out to eat dinner to celebrate his accomplishments.

No lie, as soon as I entered the place, my eyes went wide and I wanted to eat everything. That probably explains why we ordered a ton of food. I ordered a Soy Garlic Chicken Rice Bowl while my friend ordered The Belly Bombz sandwich. Then we also ordered 6 pieces of Fried Chicken Wings (lemon pepper wet sauce) and Spicy KBBQ Chicken Loaded Fries. I also got a fountain soda of Coke.

It didn't take long for our food to be ready and I was in Korean chicken heaven. Everything tasted so good and the portions were pretty big that we actually had leftovers between us, so I took the rest home. The leftovers also tasted amazing the day after.

I've been waiting for a place like Belly Bombz for awhile and I'm so glad it exists. Now I just have to stop myself from coming here all the time to eat.

Bonus: Belly Bombz is available on Grubhub!

Came here for the first time based off of raving views from a bunch of friends. Everything was great from the start. I got a chunky glitter SNS manicure and it is textured differently than your standard glitter so I understand it may take a strategic technique to complete the color. The nail tech got was assigned to didnt seem accustomed to the type of glitter and my nail was left feeling sharp and grainy. The front host was so helpful in getting me squared away as well as the manager. I'm also personally not a fan of gel top coat  on SNS because I find that it peels but she assured me she knows the correct technique to ensure the peeling doesn't happen. The fact that I was justified in being  upset about my nails and it was corrected.  That's amazing customer service! I did not leave feeling like I wasn't taken care of.

This is such a good spot for a boba shop! There is honestly no where else to get drinks like this on this side of town! So glad that I no longer have to drive 20 mins just to get boba. This place has great costumer service and is always clean. They have good options on the menu as well. The boba is always fresh too. Many places I've gone to the boba is to soft because it just sits there. But here I've never had an issue! Been here so many times and will continue to stay loyal!

The restaurant  is located right off water Street. There is plenty of parking available. We were greeted and seated quickly only several others were there. The deocr  is dated however it is clean. The hostess was courteous and quick.
    We ordered the  lunch special $5.00 . I had the orange chicken and the Mr.  had the sweet  and sour chicken with fried rice. We also were brought soup before our meals came out. I was not a huge fan of the soup.The Orange Chicken sauce was  thick and had nice flavor. The sweet and sour chicken was thin and watery. We both preferred the Orange Chicken overall. The spring roll was good it tastes similar to the ones we were accustomed on the East Coast  so that was a pleasant surprise !
     All things considered it was good meal, and portion sizes were generous especially  for the great lunch prices. I would definitely  order the Orange Chicken again and would like to revisit to try other options.

Always enjoy bfast at Biscuits! First time at this location, and they were very accommodating to our party of 10 on a Sunday morning. Staff were friendly, super efficient, and we never had to ask for anything. Food was excellent by all accounts, which makes this my favorite bfast spot in PHX. Only negative was the children's play area--it needs a thorough cleaning ASAP. Otherwise, excellent experience.

Cheers!
RS

One word: yummy! I was downtown with some friends doing a scavenger hunt and we decided upon Chico Malo for brunch. I'm glad we did! I ordered the Trio appetizer. I love, love, love guacamole but the hominy hummus is to die for!

I ordered the Chilaquiles for my main. It was so good! Spicy, flavorful, crunchy all in one bite. I'd definitely go back.

I've only been here a month and I truly regret moving here. 

I know what you're thinking mostly because I thought it too. So many great reviews, this place gotta be legit. Well one word....BUGS!! Roaches to be exact. Constant bugs. I hadn't picked up a bottle of bug spray in YEARS until I moved here. If you don't like bugs, don't move here. I stupidly trusted the reviews here that said "no bugs" (lies!) and ignored the one review here that mentioned this problem (because it was old 2016) and the one Google review that also mentioned it which was recent (but I thought maybe she was crazy because all of these positive reviews). Listen to me and them, this place has a bug problem. Avoid it at all cost. 

I've had the place sprayed, weather stripping reinforced, entry ways covered in boric acid, sticky tape to catch things coming in around the door frame, peppermint oil! You name it, I've tried it! My bottle of raid is almost empty. Again I've only been here a month! Keep in mind its October! I'd hate to see this place in the summer. 

Home should be a place where you can relax. There's no relaxing happening when you have to constantly ensure you have your raid with you at all times. Its safe to say, I won't be renewing my lease.

As I write this there's a huge bug on my living room wall. I'll attach a photo. Its not a great quality photo but its real. 2 others preceded this one this same evening. Who knows whats happening when I'm sleeping or in the other rooms. I can't save myself but there's still time to save you, don't move here. RUN! or prepare to purchase a Costco size bottle of raid...Monthly!

I truly regret moving here. I made a bad choice in picking this place. I wish I could back out of this.

Worth the Hunt!

They just need s new sign. Look for the 'Share' sign.
Great Topas and a good selection of beer. We had shrimp and tostada Topas then the fried chicken and Beet salad. All good eats!

Give it a try you will return!

Long story short - our neighbor damaged my sons car.  We asked them to find a repair shop and get quotes to fix.  They came back with this place and after I looked at reviews and the quote I agreed on the place.
We were able to bring the car in right away.  Once they saw the actual car and not the just the pictures my neighbor took they were amazed that the damage was worse than the pictures portrayed.  Stated they might need to increase quote - of course I thought to myself, but since my neighbor was going to pay I left the car.  The owner was able to have the damage fixed and honor the original quote (good for the neighbor! ha) and the work was done well and within the time frame promised.  
I hope to not need these services again, but if I do I will certainly give them a call!

Chon Thai Food brings a smile to my face. Yup, that's right, I'm jumping on the Yelp bandwagon and singing the praises for this wonderful restaurant! They have an amazing lunch special, spectacular employees, stunning presentations, delicious food and ridiculously outstanding prices!! Plus, their mango and sweet sticky rice is out-of-this-world good! It is a must when you visit. All the 5 star reviews are very well deserved.

I would give this more 3.5 stars, and rounding up due to the family friendly nature of the restaurant - easy to get a table, spacious dining room, decent food. Very nice and friendly service, accommodating to our allergy questions. We had bolognese pasta (one option was dairy/egg free), seafood risotto, and pizza. Have a nice kids' menu. Would be very comfortable for a larger family group.

I was looking for coffee and found this place in the area. Really interesting concept of: drink coffee have snacks play games. Charging station at your table really convenient. Servers were very confused and there getting proper service was prolonged. Ad 3-4 different people take my prder, then confuse it, then made me wait for a cup of coffee, tgen had difficulty with me paying due to tablet issues. They should keep napkins at the table because the water from the drinks kept making everything wet. I checked in and got free chips and guac hich was a cool deal.

I LOVE Vegas Hot!  It's super convenient and most of the instructors are great.  Prices are reasonable (compared to other yoga studios) and the studio is always clean.  Everyone is super nice.  This place has a positive impact on my life!

The studio flooring is amazingly comfortable under your yoga mat, which looks like one giant rubber band coiled all over the floor.  Nice locker room complete with showers and hair dryers.  The lockers are a little small though because my yoga mat and bag won't fit in a locker.
